locations.title: UWA Aquatic Centre
locations.address: University of Western Australia, Parkway, Crawley WA 6009

showerReviews.reviewText:
Located on the back end of campus with access via a hidden gate, you can access the UWA Aquatic centre. There is no lighting of this area after dark so it can easily be missed.
Prices are low ($7) however the facilities reflect that price.
Changing rooms are poor with no cubicles and a floor that is constantly wet.
Also there are no locker facilities available and you have to either carry your stuff poolside or trust your things will be safe in the 'changing room'.
The pools themselves are mostly fine although POORLY MANAGED as lifeguards are few and far between. Lanes are limited with a lot of slower swimmers and few mid speed lanes. No obvious lane directions led to confusion, with some lanes being taken up by just two people going back and forth (no making room for three or more to share).
The pool itself was clean and had no problem with it.
There is a general lack of administration on rules and other things, it seemed to me like I could have just walked in without paying.
Not sure why this is a public pool as it feels more like a high school pool. I hope in future UWA takes better management of the facilities as there is so much potential to make the facilities applicable for public use.
showerReviews.author: alex sullivan

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a really nice aquatic center on the UWA campus with three pools: two pools available for public lap swimming (one indoor and one outdoor) and an additional larger outdoor pool apparently for use by the swim team. I came to swim laps and it’s actually an amazing pool—the water temp is great, the pool is spotless, and the other swimmers/staff were friendly. The locker rooms are clean, but small, and most people keep their bags outside by the pool. It’s also easily accessible via the free Purple CAT bus (it’s a one way loop, so just make sure you know when the next bus is arriving).

Docking one star bc although the pool is great, the extremely limited public swim hours make this pool almost useless for anyone who’s not near the campus or who has other things to do (weekdays: 6-8:30am, 11:30-2pm, 6:30-8pm and weekends: 12-2pm).

Overall, great pool, but sadly one that I won’t be visiting again due to the limited lap swimming schedule. Lucky the Beatty Park pool is also amazing and has much more flexible hours.
showerReviews.author: Khalid M

showerReviews.reviewText: For the University students, staff and the public (especially on the weekends and the summer holiday). Affordable fees. the pools with different sizes. One is covered and provides swimming training for kids in school breaks. The large pool is reserved for Uni-water-Sports activities. Nice shower and facilities. Car park is next to the entrance with wheelchair car park. However, finding a spot for your park during the class days is a real issue. Please, try to arrange more training programs.

locations.title: Claremont Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love the Claremont pool and am here a couple times a week. The front desk staff is fantastic. They smile and quickly ring you up the $6 for open swim. The swim shop is well stocked with Funkita bathers, caps/hats, goggles and swim training equipment.

The women's change room has about 6-8 showers some are only "cold" and others have hot water. Some showers have doors on them for a little privacy others have nothing for privacy. There are plenty of toilets in working order but sometimes they are out of toilet paper early in the morning/late at night. It would be really great if they got lockers for the ladies change room! As of now, you take your belongings to the pool deck while you swim.

The pool is usually pretty busy at most times of the day especially in spring and summer, but swimmers make room for you in their lanes if you ask nicely. I like that they are open late into the evening.
showerReviews.author: Alexandra

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am only commenting on the swimming facilities.
After months of closure and  who knows how much money spent, I found the upgrade to the pools disappointing.
I only use the pool facility with my grandson of 3.
The pools are almost entirely unavailable for public use. To pay $7 and have a meagre portion of a half lane available for a child to swim in is a rip off.
I was at the pool with my 3 year old grandson. I want to SWIM with him, so the shallow paddling pool is of no use. The shallow swimming pool was 99% occupied by swim school as was 50% of the larger pool. The other 50% taken up by elderly walkers who scowl at young kids being in the lane. I have attached a picture of the quarter lane available for public use by toddler swimmers.
The outdoor area was not upgraded at all. It is still fully exposed to the elements making it mostly unusable
The showers have no way of  regulating the water temperature, which is too hot for kids.
Very disappointing. Compared to Cockburn Ark that charges half the price, it is dismal.
showerReviews.author: Marie Mal

locations.address: 42 Somerset St, East Victoria Park WA 6101

showerReviews.reviewText: A swimming centre located in East Victoria Park. It has indoor pool, outdoor pool, and also pool for swimming lessons. The pool is clean and it also separates for swimmers with slow, medium, and fast speed. They have locker rooms to put your stuff and they are easy to use. Additionally, they also have a hydrotherapy pool and a steam room. For a public entry, the fees exclude the gym. But overall, this is a good place for a swim and worth the price.

I had not been to Beatty Park for about 30 years so it was a fantastic surprise seeing how it has been updated. It is a very user friendly centre with great facilities.
The car park is excellent and we had no issues getting a spot (and shade).
The prices are reasonable and the change rooms and toilets are excellent with individual unisex cubicles, which we really appreciate. My kids and I hate big cattle barn change rooms.
You could easily spend hours at these pools with family or alone.

showerReviews.reviewText: I have travelled extensively, and I’d say this is one of the best leisure/fitness centres I’ve visited. From the quality of the gym equipment, the superlative swimming pools, the diverse choice of classes (which are included in the membership price), through to the very high levels of cleanliness, staff friendliness, and outstanding value for money: this place ticks all the boxes. Sure, this is not a swanky health club/spa, but for those who simply want to train body and mind well, you’ll be hard pushed to find better.
showerReviews.author: David Charles

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beatty Park Leisure Centre in North Perth is an outstanding community facility and easily one of the best leisure centres in WA. The pool areas are immaculate, with options for everyone — from heated indoor pools perfect for winter swimming, to outdoor lanes for lap swimmers, to kid-friendly splash zones. The water is always clean, the lifeguards are attentive, and it’s a safe and welcoming place for families.

The gym is excellent too, with modern equipment, plenty of space, and a great atmosphere. I really like the group fitness classes — there’s a huge variety, including yoga, Pilates, cycle, and high-intensity workouts, all led by motivating instructors who know how to keep sessions engaging. The change rooms and facilities are always tidy, and parking is convenient with plenty of spaces close to the entrance.

The staff are what really make Beatty Park Leisure Centre special. They’re friendly, approachable, and always happy to help, whether it’s answering questions about memberships, assisting kids with swimming lessons, or simply offering a smile at reception. You can tell they genuinely care about creating a positive experience for everyone.

If you’re in Perth and looking for a high-quality leisure centre with swimming pools, a gym, group fitness, and family-friendly facilities, I can’t recommend Beatty Park Leisure Centre enough. It’s the perfect place for health, fitness, and fun all in one spot!
showerReviews.author: Top g

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was really disappointed with my recent visit. Almost all of the swimming lanes were reserved, leaving only a few available for people like us who did not make a booking. It felt very limiting and unfair, especially for casual swimmers who just want to enjoy the pool.
On top of that, one of the staff members scolded us while we were using the slow lane (there was no leisure lane that time). We were stopping briefly in the middle because we can’t swim very well, and instead of offering guidance, the staff spoke to us quite harshly. It made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome.
I hope the management can improve lane availability for non-reserved swimmers and ensure staff communicate respectfully with all visitors, regardless of their skill level. The complex has great facilities, but the experience could be much better with more considerate service.
showerReviews.author: Kinley Yangchen

showerReviews.reviewText:
We usually have a great experience at BP. Yesterday we went for a swim as part of an injury recovery program. The undercover pool was freezing. I asked the attendant why there was no heating and he said the hydropump had been fixed and the water wouldn't be heated until the 6th of October.
I noticed a sign about the lack of heated water in the ladies change room as I was shivering out of wet bathers. Why was there no signage before I paid and entered the swimming area? I wouldn't have used the pool if I knew the heating wasn't working. There are other pools I could have attended.
The whole thing was very disappointing. I barely managed 15 minutes in the cold water. Come on BP, do better by your regulars.
showerReviews.author: Annamop Moppy

showerReviews.reviewText:
We usually have a great experience at BP. Yesterday we went for a swim as part of an injury recovery program. The undercover pool was freezing. I asked the attendant why there was no heating and he said the hydropump had been fixed and the water wouldn't be heated until the 6th of October.
I noticed a sign about the lack of heated water in the ladies change room as I was shivering out of wet bathers. Why was there no signage before I paid and entered the swimming area? I wouldn't have used the pool if I knew the heating wasn't working. There are other pools I could have attended.
The whole thing was very disappointing. I barely managed 15 minutes in the cold water. Come on BP, do better by your regulars.
showerReviews.author: Annamop Moppy

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love this place but i should tell the true. Monday-Wednesday was lovely pool temperature for 25m pool. Thursday a bit cool but I can accept that. Today It was cooler than Thursday. I was talking with her (duty manager jacket). She said this water already 28 degree. I am so upset because she just said without checking first and I am swimming everyday in Cannington leisureplex. My complain is the manner. Why did she said without check the pool?. This is public service area and she should accept that complain and check that. I was waiting 20 minutes in walking line, but she didn’t check temperature in 25m pool. It should prepare well for pool before the guest is coming.

She should know where she is working for. And Leisureplex have to make checking list before and after operation hours.
showerReviews.author: Yudhi Irawan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing to formally express my profound dissatisfaction with the recent services at specifically concerning the spa and steam room facilities.

I purchased an annual membership in June ,which includes full access to the gym, swimming pool, steam room, and spa pool. Firstly, I would like to highlight a significant service interruptthe steam room and spa pool were unavailable due to maintenance work conducted by your facility. As a paying customer, I was unable to use these services that I had paid for.

Now that these facilities have finally reopened, I have been following the new rule of exchanging for a wristband at the service desk to access the spa area. However, I have observed a glaring inconsistency in the enforcement of this policy. On a daily basis, I notice that more than half of the users in the spa area are either not wearing a wristband at all or are wearing wristbands of a different color, with no staff members present to manage or question this.

This situation is both frustrating and unfair. It creates a feeling of being penalized for being a rule-abiding member. Why should members like myself, who follow the procedures and have already endured a three-month service blackout, now receive an inferior experience compared to those who disregard the rules?

This lack of management undermines the value of my membership and shows a disregard for loyal customers.
showerReviews.author: Tony

Outside the big party room you have toilets all inside the building. It’s next to the swimming pool. Lots of car bays for guests to park nearby. We had a three year old birthday party held here. Clean up before you leave as there are other booked parties.  Clean place.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is not a 4 star venue.
The gym literally stinks of sweaty smelly equipment that's never washed, there is broken tiles all around the pools inside and out.
The lifeguards are stuck up and rude and none of the workers want to be there
For the price they charge for people to come and swim is disgusting

They had a pool party and sausage sizzle today, was expecting to rock up to something decent but there was nothing.
None of the usual features were on and when asked to turn them on was told they don't work even though I was there yesterday.
The sausage sizzle was more expensive than the Bunnings across the road.
No prizes only had 1 game(giant guess who).
It was a complete disgrace compared to last year.

And to top it off they have a silent disco for kids who are wet and expect them not to jump in the pool.

Do not expect a good time at this place it's just a pool with sad lifeguards.

Or as the locals call it  the Belmont bath.
showerReviews.author: Keith Pritchett

showerReviews.reviewText: Be careful when wanting to cancel or not wanting to continue your pass, they will say it is cancelled but will continue your contract with out your  consent. I attended multiple times to dis continue my gym pass and was told one each occasion it was cancelled, money was taken out of my account without my knowledge. I was refused a refund. A very dodgy place, with broken gym equipment and uncleaned change rooms. I would recommend reconsidering your choice when signing up.

locations.title: Bayswater Waves
locations.address: and, Cnr Broun Avenue, Priestley St, Embleton WA 6062

showerReviews.reviewText: Amazing space for your kiddos, and adults alike. They have the wave pool that goes every 30 mins for 10 mins long, a river pool where your kids can play (with adult supervision for kids under 6), a good size pool for just relaxing, walking swim, and they also have the area for swimming lessons. The complex has a gym too and an outdoor playground for children after swimming. Sauna and jacuzzi are also available and a water slide. Good for all seasons as this is an indoor/outdoor swimming pool.
showerReviews.author: monchang

showerReviews.reviewText: Amazing space for your kiddos, and adults alike. showerReviews.reviewText: A Monday morning during school term. $27 for a double ring, 2 x small and 1 x large. The kids used it once and at the end of it we were told to get out of the lazy river so they could do swimming lessons in the end pool. We had families (adults and little kids) pushing past us the opposite direction so that we couldn’t even float down slowly as we were expected to move the rings sideways to make way for people swimming there. Absolutely not relaxing and very disappointed considering we paid for this. A life guard explained they can’t stop swimmers going in the area, that you pay for use of the blow up not the lazy river as it indicates online. So we took a break for lunch while the swimming lesson was on, and when we went to get the inflatables they had been taken my other older kids. Even though we had the arm bands on and no one else did, there was zero interest in trying to help us get the inflatables back for our use. Understand the lifeguards have other more important things to do than patrol inflatables - but we were charged so much on-top of entrance fee and unable to use our items!!! I don’t recommend, really wanted it to be good but it’s not well organised or helpful when there is a problem.
showerReviews.author: Amy Tennant

showerReviews.reviewText: Very very run down needs a major upgrade, lots of wear and tear and rust . No showers outside the change room is strange and hard for kids,  and the facilities are very antiquated. Lazy river needs more jets as it doesn't really move. I think I last went as a child over 20 years ago and hasn't changed much.  The cafe is ok though .

showerReviews.reviewText:
So me and my lovely ladies rolled up on this ridiculously hot day, and honestly? It was phenomenal. The water was so cold it felt like the pool was personally trying to reset my nervous system. I stepped in and immediately forgot my name for two seconds.

Now, look… there were bees. Like, a shocking amount of bees. I don’t know who told them this was their designated splash zone, but these dudes were hovering around the edges like tiny lifeguards judging everyone’s form. I respect them, but also: please leave me alone while I float in the shallow end.

They’ve got this water slide that looks like it was built for thrill seekers. It looks fun. It also looks terrifying. I saw a kid go down it screaming with joy and I thought, ‘Yeah, no, I will absolutely perish if I try that.’ So I didn’t. Heroic decision, honestly. And then there’s the wave pool, which is cool. It fires up and suddenly everyone becomes a sea creature discovering currents for the first time. The waves are tiny, like baby ocean ripples, but I’ve still seen people struggling in there. I watched one guy get smacked in the chest by a wave the size of a toddler and he acted like Poseidon himself tried to take him out.

There were lots of families and children everywhere. It's a whole ecosystem of tiny humans splashing, yelling, and doing whatever kids do. Plus there were the Serious Swimmers: those people who swim laps like they’re training for the Olympics. I felt judged for doggy paddling.

Meanwhile the gals and I?
We’re just drifting around like enchanted pool ghosts, here strictly for the vibes. No athleticism, no purpose, just pure summertime floating.

Now… the change rooms and toilets. Oh boy. This is where the star rating takes a hit. The floor is always soaking wet, like the tiles themselves are sweating from anxiety. And I have unfortunately witnessed… things. Human parts. Random bits. Stray appendages I did not consent to visually encounter. It’s like entering a cursed dungeon where modesty goes to die.

Overall? Amazing day. Cold water, nice staff, bees that may or may not unionize soon.
showerReviews.author: Mildly Irritated

My son does swimming lessons here weekly.
I can’t give enough praise about his instructor Chris. He is so kind and patient with the kids, he’s the reason my son is absolutely thriving in the water and has gained so much confidence. Chris takes the time to form a beautiful bond with each of the kids. He is an asset to the centre.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I can't express how disappointed I am with this place.

The whole floor is dirty, jacuzzi frame looks like it's never been cleaned, it's literally turned yellow/brown. There was a huge roach on the female change room floor. Crackers lying on the floor next to cafe entrance.

Really, this place needs to be taken care of. The main problem here (comparing to all the aquaparks I've been to) is letting people come in wearing outside shoes. Ridiculous.

On top of all that a bird flew in to the main area, one of the staff at first tried to get rid of it, but quickly gave up.

This place looks and feels feral.
showerReviews.author: Maja Malczyszyn

showerReviews.reviewText:
I came back today（13.10.2025）. The water was very dirty and the sand was in my feet. We left in less than 20 minutes. It was a terrible swimming pool.

——8 months ago——
I saw a little boy almost drowning, but luckily his sister noticed and saved him. Meanwhile, the lifeguard wasn’t paying attention at all and kept chatting for a very long time.

Parents need to keep a close eye on their children and take good care of them.👀❤️

showerReviews.reviewText: During Vac swim and school holidays this car park is 90% fully parked.  Lots of visitors with kids and parents come swimming here. Sonetimes there are not enough shower cubicles and change cubicles to use in the women’s change room.  It is hard to find parking during weekdays. Easier parking if you come on Sunday afternoon. Or Saturday sometimes.  The floor is really dirty.  Some loose band aid strips on floor. You can also see spit and loose hair on the floor.  The shower cubicle floor even has chips on it.  The change cubicle is dirty due to the high traffic and usage. Cleaning upkeep not good enough. One out of order tap, one out of order change room and one out of order toilet.  About six shower cubicles, 5 change cubicles, 10 toilet cubicles installed in main women’s change room.  Outside there is one unisex, shower and baby change room in one. Also two separate change cubicles outside men’s change room.
showerReviews.author: Fiona Yee

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been coming to the Terry Tyzack centre for probably a decade now. I have a full membership but I basically just use the 50m lap pool outside.
I'm astonished by the negative reviews this centre receives occasionally. In my experience I find the staff to be professional, polite and courteous - never any issues there. Whenever I've raised a concern it's been dealt with patiently and appropriately.
The facilities here are all very good. Well maintained and quite good quality. Any comments about cleanliness or occasional service shutdowns - you have to remember, this place probably handles 1000s of human beings per week. That HAS to take a toll on equipment and machinery, no?
Yes, on occasion, the sauna or spa will be shutdown for cleaning and maintenance. This is normal and necessary. Complaining about it only reveals a lack of insight into facility management.
Contrary to other reviewers, there are indeed 3 separate washrooms for males and females.
The "flagship" washroom is located near the indoor pools and I suspect it receives the most use. I only use the male washroom, but it has 4(5?) showers, and adequate toileting. The second tier washroom is located in the corridor near the physiotherapy and gym. Again, 3 showers, adequate toilets. The third (and probably least used) washroom is accessed from the external pool area and has 3 showers and adequate toileting. That's a total of 10 showers and about 8 sit down toilets.
Regarding swimming times and availability, you have to use common sense. If you come during peak usage time, many lanes are full and there will be many lanes reserved, because this is a functional way that swimming centres everywhere operate. It's not a flaw of this centre specifically. If you want to swim with no-one around, come when it's early, come when it's late, come when the weather is crappy and no-one else wants to swim (I'm sharing all my secrets). On this note, practice swimming politeness. Don't be an arrogant swimmer swimming "on top" of slower swimmers. Don't be a clueless swimmer and swim super slow in the fast lane. It's easy to wait a couple moments at the end of your lap for someone faster to pass you, then swim at your own happy pace behind them.
A special shout-out to the cleaners at this centre, by the way. The un-sung heroes of large scale facilities like this. I have seen people complain about the lack of cleanliness and after 10 years I can attest to the excellent work the cleaners do. Remember, some humans are responsible and clean up after themselves, but it is commonplace for people to come and use a facility, then leave their rubbish (of whatever kind) for "someone else" to clean up.
I would say the "flagship" washrooms get the messiest, because they are the most popular. Cleaners clean them neatly, then a bunch of customers come through - and completely mess them up again. It's normal. It's not a failing of the centre. If you find something messy or dirty...pick it up and put it in the bin! Or, politely inform the staff at reception who will notify the cleaners, who will come and clean things up. Again.
Lastly I've noticed remarks about staff members and racism. I highly doubt this. I find all the staff at this centre to be professional and polite. They are "frontline" staff, and as such they deal with customers all day, everyday, the good and the bad. Being in customer service is one of the hardest jobs there is I reckon. Dealing with such a broad customer base - parents, carers with ability-impaired clients, teenagers, the elderly, etc etc. All day everyday. If patience is lost on occasion, I wouldn't take it personally. I always try to approach my interactions with people in customer service from a perspective of "how can I make their day a little easier in this moment".
Anyway. Terry Tyzack is a great place, and it's worth whatever membership you're paying. Have a good one.
showerReviews.author: Max

showerReviews.reviewText:
Enjoy this place very much taking my 4 month old for his free swimming lessons (free classes for ages 4-6months). Paid parking although can get a parking permit from the centre if you’re taking lessons there! The lady who served me was very lovely and the instructor, Elizabeth, was very nice as the father & myself took turns with baby.

Ramos available around easy for wheelchairs & prams! Easy accessible change rooms & showers. There are change tables by the pool to easily change baby in & out of bathers, nappies or so.

Highly recommend for first time mums as it’s free, easily accessible & not overwhelming amount of other mamas with children ☺️ excited to come more having a look at other areas of the centre as my son gets older.. and that’s when we’ll start looking into other pool centres with bigger play & more kids to socialise!
showerReviews.author: B.

showerReviews.reviewText: Anat and her team at Aquanat are incredible. Our 3yo daughter hadn’t been to swimming lessons for a few years and I felt so much guilt about her getting ‘behind’. After committed to 2-3 terms at Aquanat she is bowing incredibly confident, not just in the pool but diving through waves at the beach. It has taken a load off my shoulders, and I am so grateful for the team at Aquanat!
showerReviews.author: Ashlee Crabbe

showerReviews.reviewText: We've thoroughly enjoyed our experience over the years at AQUANAT.  Having experienced swimming lessons with two of our little boys in Canada, it highlighted to us how fortunate we were to have Anat when we left Australia in 2021 with only one little boy.  Since returning from overseas, despite a change in location (Mosman Park to Alfred Cove) we are willing to travel for swimming lessons for our now three little boys, based on Anat (& Sharon is fantastic) & their unique approach that fosters a positive learning environment with a wonderful pool space that isn't daunting for the kids!

locations.title: Anytime Fitness

showerReviews.reviewText:
Anytime Fitness on Murray Street, Perth, is an outstanding gym that delivers on all the essentials and more. The moment you walk in, you’re greeted by a clean, modern, and well-organized space that feels motivating and energizing. The gym is spacious, well-lit, and fully equipped with a wide range of machines, free weights, cardio equipment, and functional training areas. Whether you’re focused on building strength, improving endurance, or just maintaining general fitness, this place has everything you need.

All the equipment is in excellent condition and clearly well-maintained. I never had to wait long for a machine, and everything was laid out thoughtfully to avoid overcrowding, even during busy hours. I also appreciated the dedicated mobility and stretching zone — a rare find that makes recovery and warm-ups far more comfortable.

One of the best aspects is the 24/7 access, which gives total flexibility to fit workouts around a busy schedule. Whether it’s early morning, late evening, or in between appointments, you can pop in whenever suits you. The access system works smoothly and the environment feels secure and safe at all hours.

The change rooms are clean, with good water pressure in the showers, well-stocked facilities, and secure lockers available for personal belongings.

And finally, the location couldn’t be better — right on Murray Street in the heart of Perth’s CBD. It’s perfect for locals, office workers, or even travelers who want to stay active while in town.

Overall, a top-tier gym experience with excellent equipment, great atmosphere, and unbeatable convenience. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: R L

showerReviews.reviewText:
Anytime Fitness is one of the world’s leading gym franchises, known for its round-the-clock accessibility, supportive atmosphere, and global reach. Founded in 2002 in Minnesota, USA, the brand has rapidly expanded to over 5,000 clubs in more than 30 countries, serving millions of members across the globe. Whether you're in New York, Tokyo, London, or Singapore, chances are you’re never far from an Anytime Fitness club.

At the heart of the brand is its core promise: convenience, community, and personalized fitness. Unlike traditional gyms, Anytime Fitness stands out by offering members 24/7 access, 365 days a year. This means you can work out on your own schedule—early morning, late at night, or even during holidays—using a secure access key. For those with demanding jobs, unconventional schedules, or a need for flexibility, this feature alone makes Anytime Fitness incredibly appealing.

Each club is independently owned and operated, yet they all maintain a standardized level of quality. Facilities typically include a well-equipped space with cardio machines, strength training equipment, free weights, and functional training zones. Many clubs also offer private restrooms, showers, and lockers, emphasizing comfort and cleanliness.

Another key advantage is the global access. Members of any Anytime Fitness club can access all other clubs worldwide at no additional cost. This is a huge plus for frequent travelers, remote workers, or anyone who wants to maintain consistency in their fitness routine across locations.

More than just a place to exercise, Anytime Fitness fosters a strong sense of community. Many clubs are smaller than big-box gyms, which allows for more personalized service and a friendly, neighborhood vibe. Staff often know members by name, and there’s a culture of mutual encouragement. Clubs regularly organize fitness challenges, group training, workshops, and social events, creating opportunities for members to connect beyond workouts.

Professional support is readily available. Certified personal trainers offer one-on-one sessions tailored to individual goals—whether it's weight loss, strength building, injury recovery, or general wellness. In addition, the Anytime Fitness app provides virtual coaching, workout tracking, and customized programs for those who prefer to train independently.

One of the brand’s missions is to make fitness accessible to everyone, regardless of age or fitness level. Many clubs welcome seniors, teens, and beginners, and offer adaptive workouts to suit different needs. The atmosphere is non-intimidating and inclusive, making it easier for newcomers to feel comfortable.

In conclusion, Anytime Fitness is more than just a gym—it’s a global movement that empowers individuals to take charge of their health on their own terms. With its 24/7 accessibility, community-driven environment, professional support, and worldwide reach, it’s a trusted choice for people seeking a flexible, supportive, and effective fitness solution.
showerReviews.author: Emily Johnson

showerReviews.author: Emily Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Anytime Fitness lives up to its name by offering unmatched 24/7 access, making it one of the most convenient gym chains for people with busy and unpredictable schedules. Whether you’re an early riser, a night owl, or someone squeezing in a workout between shifts, the flexibility of being able to train at any time is one of the brand’s biggest advantages.

Each Anytime Fitness location typically features a clean, well-maintained space with a modern layout. The equipment is up-to-date and covers a wide range of fitness needs, including free weights, strength machines, cardio gear, and functional training zones. Whether you’re into weightlifting, circuit training, or just hopping on a treadmill, there’s something here for every fitness level.

One of the best things about Anytime Fitness is its global access. Once you're a member, you can use any location worldwide, which is perfect for frequent travelers. The gym’s key fob system allows secure, hassle-free entry even when staff are not present.

The atmosphere is friendly and welcoming, making it especially good for beginners or those who may feel intimidated in larger, more intense gym environments. The crowd is usually a mix of regular gym-goers, working professionals, and newcomers, and the vibe is casual but respectful. There’s rarely a wait for machines, and the overall environment is focused and non-intimidating.

Many locations offer personal training services and group classes, depending on the franchise. Trainers are usually certified, supportive, and able to tailor plans based on individual goals—whether it’s weight loss, muscle gain, or improved endurance.

Cleanliness and hygiene standards are consistently high. Wipes and spray bottles are available for cleaning equipment after use, and the gym layout allows for plenty of space between machines, promoting comfort and safety during workouts.

What really stands out is the sense of community. Despite being a franchise, many Anytime Fitness locations go out of their way to create a personal touch—celebrating member milestones, organizing fitness challenges, and encouraging motivation through social media groups or in-gym boards.

In conclusion, Anytime Fitness is a great all-round gym solution—ideal for people who value flexibility, a clean and safe environment, and supportive service. While it may not have the expansive space of a mega-gym, it more than makes up for it with accessibility, quality equipment, and a welcoming community spirit.

What really stands out is the sense of community. Despite being a franchise, many Anytime Fitness locations go out of their way to create a personal touch—celebrating member milestones, organizing fitness challenges, and encouraging motivation through social media groups or in-gym boards.

In conclusion, Anytime Fitness is a great all-round gym solution—ideal for people who value flexibility, a clean and safe environment, and supportive service. While it may not have the expansive space of a mega-gym, it more than makes up for it with accessibility, quality equipment, and a welcoming community spirit.
showerReviews.author: Isabella De Rosa

locations.title: TheTrack Langley

showerReviews.reviewText:
Easily the best gym by outfit and design in Perth CBD (maybe even the whole of Perth!) there are so many machines, some of which I’ve never even seen or used before - but I’m sure would be familiar with more professional types. The brand Technogym features heavily here and they definitely make quality machines - very intuitive to use, feel great and are true to weight. The gym is CLEAN! Can’t overstate this, the managers manage to keep this gym smelling and looking great every day time I’ve been in which is just such a bonus compared to almost every other gym I’ve been to in the past; the gym is just kept really well. The change rooms/toilets have private lockers available for rent and are clean and very spacious! Suitable for anyone to prep for the workday/wind down from the work day.

The team are also fantastic. Jireh and Yvonne were the two managers that I met and they were both so helpful and friendly. They answered all my questions during the workout about machines, form and more. They were so helpful with the sign up process and took me on a tour around the gym to help me familiarise myself with the equipment. The culture this team are building is great - strict cleanliness policies as well as a policed entry so that people aren’t sneaking friends in etc. I met both the owners Don and Fabian from the Track Willetton and they are just upstanding people who know how to run a good business. The price is incredibly reasonable given the quality of the gym, it’s no wonder that so many people have signed up already just a couple of days after opening.

If you’re training at another gym in the city - do yourself a favour and come here instead.
showerReviews.author: Jonathan Quay

locations.title: Plus Fitness 24/7 Manning

showerReviews.reviewText:
I did promise the owners I would post a 5 star review once I was officially recognised as a member of Manning which finally happened yesterday. I originally joined North Perth as my roommate had been going there for over a year by that point however as I did not really enjoy the North Perth franchise and we both live in Cannington so I decided to go to Manning instead as it's only a short 10 minute drive away.

Fun fact, I used to live in Manning over a decade ago for a couple of years and back then Plus Fitness never used to be there. All there was IGA and that pharmacy next to it. Since returning for the first time in a decade, I've noticed the gym has transformed the area into a community hub.

The gym itself is very clean and modern. When I joined, it looked to be in a state of disarray with old equipment and perienally empty vending machines but ever since the new owners took over the whole place has transformed. Wayne has put so much effort into upgrading the whole place since taking over including a state of the art motion detection water fountain, brand new Technogym equipment and even little formal touches like a Dyson hairdryer in the showers.

Sabrina is a wonderful manager. Warm, friendly and welcoming towards all members. My favorite thing about this place is the non-judgemental vibe you get from everyone there. At no point have I ever felt uncomfortable about being judged by my peers whenever I'm here. There's another girl whose name I don't know I've seen in the office before the new owners took over and she was also extremely helpful.

I've been to a few Plus Fitness franchises so far like North Perth (obviously), Mount Lawley and Wembley but I am yet to come across one as good as this.
showerReviews.author: Scott Crawley

showerReviews.reviewText: Having the best day of 2025 on my first day at Next Gen Gym - Kings Park. Where do I start? It has two heated swimming pools (indoor and at the roof top), jacuzzi, steam, sauna, state of the art equipment and various of group training sessions. Tennis courts and squash courts. Reformer pilates. A nice cafe and comfy cozy lounge to hang out with your friends. The membership comes with extra perks like whole body analysis with InBody machine, Induction with a Personal Trainer that can design your personalized training program, and guest pass. Elliot Fris, thank you so much for taking me on a tour. I never thought that there are so many facilities available with such a value for money membership fee at Next Gen.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The public toilets at Coogee Beach are clean, well-maintained, and conveniently located near the main areas of the beach. It’s great to have easy access to facilities, especially during busy weekends or after a swim.

The upkeep is generally good, but like most beachside amenities, it can get a little crowded at peak times. More regular cleaning during busy hours would make it even better.

Overall, it’s a handy and essential part of the beach experience. Glad to have these facilities nearby when visiting Coogee!

showerReviews.reviewText:
So mi float into dis Perth place, fresh off di turquoise sea pon mi loyal unicorn steed—me an’ him, searchin’ fi di hotel for some comfort, an’ a hot shower after a few salty days on di ocean.
Mi spot dis small but tidy structure right dere pon di shoreline. It have clean lines, a roof, an’ two doors—exactly what mi imagine a minimalist beach hotel would look like in Australia. Mi smile an’ seh, “A likkle boutique spot. Quiet. Peaceful. Dem really know how fi treat a Jamaican king right.”
Mi walk in, unicorn over mi shoulder, expectin’ a warm welcome an’ maybe a mint on di pillow. But mi quickly realise… mi hotel got no lobby. No bed. Not even a receptionist, unless yuh count di man brushin’ him teeth by di sink.
Mi seh, “Hold up now… where di room service? Where mi key?” Mi open one door, an’ it smell... strong. Mi open di next door, an’ cold wata start pour from a silver pipe straight outta di wall. Mi seh, “Mi guess dis di spa section!”
Mi brave it anyway—mi rinse off under di icy stream, feelin’ mi soul leave mi body an’ float back to Kingston. An’ right den, a sign fall off di door sayin’: ‘Public Toilet & Showers – City of Perth.’
Mi seh, “Lawd Gad, mi jus’ bathe inna di outhouse!”
But mi cyaan lie… di tiles was clean, di wata pressure was righteous, an’ dat breeze comin’ off di ocean made mi feel like royalty—even if it was di kind of royalty who get changed outside next to a bin.
So mi give it four stars—lost one star ‘cause it wasn’t a real hotel, but big up to di Perth city council for di free cold shower an’ unexpected cultural experience.
Note to travellers: Not every building by di beach wid two doors is a beachfront resort. Sometime it’s just where di locals handle their bidness.
🦄🚿🇦🇺✨
One love, one rinse, one unexpected holiday.
showerReviews.author: Pat Jefferson

locations.title: City Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: City Beach in Perth is a stunning coastal gem that perfectly blends natural beauty with a relaxed, modern vibe. By day, its pristine white sand and turquoise waters create a postcard-perfect scene, ideal for swimming, sunbathing, or a refreshing stroll along the shore. As the sun sets, the beach transforms into a magical spot with golden skies reflecting off the ocean, making it one of Perth’s most picturesque sunset locations. The surrounding cafes, grassy picnic areas, and clean facilities add to its charm, making City Beach a favourite for both locals and visitors looking to unwind by the sea in a serene yet vibrant setting.
showerReviews.author: sudheera shanilka

locations.title: Cottesloe Beach Public Toilet

showerReviews.reviewText: My party needed to visit these amenities for three ladies of different ages, including an elderly person in a wheelchair. The toilet block was very far from any parking, so very difficult to access with the wheelchair… make sure you are not desperate to go when you visit! The building is very old and could have been interesting had it been looked after, but sadly it has been neglected terribly. The facilities were basic, and not well equipped at all. No toilet paper. Dirty and smelly. No sanitary bins in the cubicles. The disabled toilet was IN the ladies’, so a male relative had to go in to the ladies toilet section to assist the wheelchair user. The soap was unreachable for the wheelchair user, but don’t worry, this poor design isn’t based on ableism… another lady who was short also needed to ask a complete stranger to reach her some soap! The only good thing about this toilet block is leaving it and never returning.
showerReviews.author: Cathy BlueTuesday

locations.title: South City Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great dog friendly beach.
Shore line stretches out so even if the waves are bigger, doggos can still go into the water without too much danger. The sand is clean and well maintained, not a lot of dried seafood and sticks etc

Close walk to car park area, has easy access showers to rinse off as well.
showerReviews.author: Shirley Yeung

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
There is a 200 meter sandy track to the beach which is sheltered from the wind so the sand gets really hot even on days that arent that hot.

There is a doggie and people wash station and a drink fountain for both at the carpark end of the track to the beach.

The beach is a beautiful sandy beach which goes for miles.

You cant head north as that is a no dog area and when heading south you may find the nudist beach.

This is also the back of the military base. Every so often they close that end of the beach due to live firing exercises.
showerReviews.author: Beven Hanlon

showerReviews.reviewText: I love this beach, very wide and large and perfect for taking dogs for a long stroll. There are a few entrances, in the very first one (coming from north) there’s a shower with 2 shower heads, very top and low, and a fountain for human and dogs. Bags for poo provided as well. Not much parking though.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Small carpark across road, opposite the soft sand beach access path at the most northern end the beach. Dog water station, beach rinse off shower plus a lost and found at this location. Plenty of bags and bins.

Is a nice dog beach. Only downside is other owners. They often forget to be close enough to give a verbal command, have eyes on their own dog or carry a lead with them.

We deliberately went at a time it was known to be quiet due to some behavioural issues still being addressed. Sadly, the actions of other owners on a 2km long forced us to head home early.
showerReviews.author: T N

locations.title: Whitfords Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
Truly pristine and amazing vegetation.
24/7 open and well maintained, clean shower/ toilet complex about 25 meters from parking as well as the beach

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: Parking can be an issue but unlike Mullaloo where there is absolutely no overspill, you can always park on the sandy stretch north of the car park here. There are three main pathways onto Whitfords, all are paved and there's not too much of a hill down to the beach. Makes for packing a fully loaded trolley easy! There are no lifeguards but the swimming is always great. Go at low / mid tide for best swimming.
showerReviews.author: AVR

showerReviews.reviewText: If you plan a morning visit to Westfield’s Whitfield Shopping Centre, or take in a movie there, bring a towel and your swimming gear. For there you can then catch a bus to the beach. Or go on a short drive to the beach to the nearest beach parking station, where there’s a lovely beach walk. It’s about 1:5 kms, going northwards between the Whitfords and Mullaloo Beaches. Then you can have lunch at the beaut Mullaloo Tavern. When you are ready, meander back through a line of long, high green strips alongside the beach that join up a few small parks. There are lots of gorgeous, high sea views along the coast, and heaps of beautiful Australian trees, flora and local birds to enjoy.  Recommend.
showerReviews.author: Susanne Harford

locations.title: City of Perth Surf Life Saving Club

showerReviews.reviewText:
City Beach is just one example of why Australia is one the best places on the planet. This beach is extremely well maintained, a has plenty of amenities for tourists and locals alike.  e.g. a Play-set for children , BBQ areas, Change Rooms and Showers.

The staff at the SLS City Beach are ever so friendly and very professional. They do an outstanding job of patrolling the beach and always willing to help. From information on the safest place to swim with toddlers to the best cafe near by.
showerReviews.author: Eric Paul Goldie

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a family members wedding there. It was a beautiful venue with really friendly and accomodating staff.

Toilets and amenities where clean, lock was busted on the disabled toilet though it wouldn't lock.

Not sure what the go was but outside every 5 minutes or so it stunk of sewerage. Thought it may of been seaweed but when we walked down the beach the smell went away.

Also no tea or coffee for the oldies was a huge let down

I probably wouldn't recommend a function there if the sewerage smell was still there maybe a septic issue.
showerReviews.author: Peter c

locations.title: Swanbourne Nedlands Surf Life Saving Club

showerReviews.reviewText:
Club Administrator with an attitude.
I'm a local, retiree, frequently swimming solo long distance at Swanbourne.
I had noticed the state government has spent a lot of taxpayers money for impressive club house extensions.
I noticed the club Administrator uses the facilities during the day for non club activities, such as personal working from home.
I contacted the Club Administrator, Jacqui Ross, to become a member so I could use the facilities during the day when swimming such as perhaps shower and change after swims.
However, Jacqui wrote back to me, not in a welcoming way.
Basically putting many obstacles to me becoming a member.... probably because she wants the facilities for herself during the day .
Not impressed with that attitude.
showerReviews.author: Capitaine Bonhomme

locations.title: Mandurah Coastal Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed over the weekend on a grass site with a pop up camper. The site was lovely and spacious and the grass was beautiful, lush and green, coming out of winter (early November). We overlooked the playground, which was clean and fenced, perfect for our 5 year old.  The toilet block was clean and reasonably modern, with a touch pad lock. The camp kitchen was amazing, well equipped and had a tv. The location was very convenient, a short walk to restaurants at Dolphin Quay and into town. Our friends stayed in a two bedroom cabin and were very happy with it. The kitchen was well equipped and the outside lounge area was perfect for their kids, also overlooking the playground. The park is dog friendly and its a short walk to the beach and dog beach. The only downside was the area it is in. There were police sirens day and night and lots of homeless people hanging around the IGA. This is totally out of the control of the park owners/managers, but would perhaps prevent us from returning.
showerReviews.author: Sarah Travis

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not the most comfortable experience.

Room is small, very small for two adults.

Complete lack of storage space, no hooks in bathroom leaving us having to throw our stuff on the damp floor or in the wet sink.

The shower and bathroom doors make such a loud squeaky I reckon' the neighbours could hear it.

They advertise free wifi, but our unit was too far from the access point making the wifi useless.

Trying to get hot water takes forever making me sad to see how much water goes to waste.

Just not our lucky stay this time unfortunately.
showerReviews.author: Ger Hoelk

Arrived late and had no assistance, which added some stress. Probably wouldn’t return, but it’s a best convenient spot for camping or campervans near the city. Booking is easy . And I realise there are no after hours call for assist. Not good not bad just average
showerReviews.author: Kenson Ho

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked a cabin with complete amenities. Spacious and clean. Friendly staff at the counter with easy check in and out. They charged a deposit of 250AUD, which is quite high for one night stay, but received back the deposit a few hours after checked out.
showerReviews.author: Trip.com Member

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked a cabin with complete amenities. Spacious and clean. Friendly staff at the counter with easy check in and out. They charged a deposit of 250AUD, which is quite high for one night stay, but received back the deposit a few hours after checked out.
showerReviews.author: Trip.com Member

showerReviews.reviewText: There was no hot water in the shower and we couldn’t take a bath. There was no heater in the room either . It was quite small for 2. We couldn’t change a room as the reception closes after 6 pm. You also have to throw your own trash and ensure you do not leave a big mess or the security deposit will be forfeited $100 for cleaning.

locations.title: Queen's Grove Caravan Village

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic spot to explore Perth without breaking the bank. We stayed here for two weeks and loved it! Amenities block was modern, faultless and cleaned every-day. Yes it is close to the airport but it didn't bother us or seem to bother anyone else one bit. Sites are spacious and couldn't see why any caravan or vehicle wouldn't fit. I would highly recommend and would definitely use this park again if I came back to Perth. Thanks John for an awesome stay!
showerReviews.author: Tom Barry

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic spot to explore Perth without breaking the bank. We stayed here for two weeks and loved it! Amenities block was modern, faultless and cleaned every-day. showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here for 2 weeks on a powered site and was more than happy with our stay. The owner John is lovely and comes around regularly to make sure your ok. The toilet/ shower block looks new, lovely hot shower and cleaner does great job! Yes you are near the airport so there are planes flying over you, but the noise didn’t bother us at all. Very good price compared to others we looked at in Perth. 10 minute walk from train station. What more do you need?
showerReviews.author: Gemma Murray

showerReviews.reviewText:
Management are helpful and after all the problems we have had always moving from park to park we finally have permanent spot. If only it happened earlier I would still have my van. The toilets and shower facilities are modern and the neighbours are friendly and helpful.
The 7/11 is next door and the BWS and take away is just 3 mins down the road.
Being near the car of Welshpool and Treasure Rd and a servicestation it can get noisy, but after a few days you block the noise of traffic and aircraft out.
I have never been happier or felt safer, best of all they allow animals. Hopefully I will be able to find a puppy to join our happy home.
showerReviews.author: Katie-anne Wallis

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was worried after reading the bad comments but I liked this place and stayed one week.
People living there permanently were very nice with us.
People are super quiet at night.
There are a lot of planes flying in the area so you need to get used to it before being able to sleep in late. It didnt bother me too much as I used earplugs.
Very modern and clean amenities.
Campspots flats and in good conditions.
Can be a cheap base to explore Perth , public transport nearby.
Would stay again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
DON'T VISIT!!! I'M SERIOUS!
This place is not for visitors. Only shady permanents living there. Most of them behave like they use hard drugs regularly. Didn't feel safe at all. Was happy I was with my partner and not alone. Not a place to be alone in the night as a woman. Still felt the need to lock every cardoor while sleeping. Park was indeed renovated lately but they managed to run the place down pretty fast. According to my partner the toilet and showers!! where full of diarrhoea. Obviously smelling insanly bad. And no they didnt cleaned it up... seems like a normal thing there. Woman's bathrooms was better. Our "site" was a peace of concrete in between 2 semipermanets directly infront of the dumping station. No need to say how it smelled...
Also airplanes fly so close over you, you can read the numbers written on them.
showerReviews.author: Hellena

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have stayed here a couple of times with our van, lastly with a 2 bed cabin for family as well. Cabins are modern, spotless, spacious and well appointed.
2nd time we stayed we asked for a drive through site as some of the other standard sites are a bit tricky to get into with a caravan when it’s busy.
All in all a great location. Had no issues with thieving as others mention. Amenities spotless too and the radio a great touch. Will be back again a bit later in year

showerReviews.reviewText: We have just spent a fair amount of time staying at Discovery Park Perth Airport during a 14-month stint of caravan living whilst building a house. It was the perfect place to stay; we absolutely loved it. The park itself looks beautiful and the amenities are modern and clean. The staff, like Jenny, Sharon and Paul, are absolutely lovely, so warm, friendly and helpful. This is not always the case and certainly helps set this caravan park apart from others. We found our stay quiet and relaxing with everything we could want. It is perfect for those travelling with dogs. We cannot wait to return for another stay very soon. Highly recommended! Mel and Fred :)

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site was the best site I visited over the past week staying at 4 sites that were scoring 4.5 and above. I do not understand how this site is now only 4.1, perhaps due to historical factors. But for sure, my stay was awesome, ensuite toilets well stocked with good amenities and the place was quiet and conducive for children. I was briefed to drive only at 5km/ hr for the kids safety.

The site was spacious, every parks were spaced away from each other and the entire place was quiet at the evening.

Maybe just one thing they need to work on is to extend the wifi signal to the farthest ends, that’s the only smallest gap

There are also charging ports in the camp kitchen, so you dont need a powered site if you dont want one. The toilets are clean and there is a pool for the sites vistors.

showerReviews.reviewText:
There is a reason this place is the cheapest in Perth! Managment is very poor. They have rooms for addicts and dv cases and one of them stole my property from the camp kitchen.
I have overheard the caretaker belittling other employees on several occasions. Caretaker threw out my towel while I was at the shop getting supplies.
Not yo mention you need a packed lunch and a watter bottle to get to the toilet block!
Take your own kitchen ware as the camp kitchen has nothing in it anymore.
Previous management had it fully stocked.
Take plenty of mossie repelent in spring and summer as there is  a drain and a small river  close by the mossies will take small children away lol.
Its  not actually in the swan valley!
But its close to a rough neighbourhood!
The only good thing about this place was the lovely ladies in reception!
Head to another park is my advice!😀👌
showerReviews.author: Dazza P

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed a week. It was a perfect landing spot for our activities at Gudgegannup. The receptionist on arrival (Blonde lady) was lovely,  and checked ys in early.

Big room, 2 double/queen beds, kitchennette, lounge,  TV, dining table, wardrobe. Toilet and showers were shared  but clean, and close by. Car park out front.

Laundry, card operated machines at $7 per load.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was our second visit to Midland, and unfortunately it may be our last. As a Big 4 property, we were disappointed by the noticeable presence of individuals who appeared to be under the influence of drugs, along with unsupervised children behaving disruptively and using inappropriate language. We would not feel comfortable leaving belongings unsecured or children unattended.

On a positive note, the amenities were well maintained the toilets and showers were clean and the staff were welcoming.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Classic camp-site experience on well-kept grounds.
Friendly and accommodating staff, access to games room, outdoor pool, and hot tub with shower and toilet blocks. Very clean. The cabins are very nice with all you'd need for a home away from home stay. The entire experience is classic, affordable, and quiet. Close to public transport and local shops while being just a stones throw out from the wine region of Swan Valley.
showerReviews.author: PJ Little

showerReviews.reviewText: Have stayed here many times over the past six yes, from their single rooms to their powered sites. Camp kitchen, laundry and ablutions block always modern, clean and tidy. Book well ahead to avoid disappointment. Situated in the heart of Midland, accessible to all major shops.
showerReviews.author: Patrick Douglas

showerReviews.reviewText: Have stayed here many times over the past six yes, from their single rooms to their powered sites. Camp kitchen, laundry and ablutions block always modern, clean and tidy. Book well ahead to avoid disappointment. Situated in the heart of Midland, accessible to all major shops.
showerReviews.author: Patrick Douglas

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed for 2 night in the April school holidays in a family cabin (shared bathroom).

The first thing to note is that this is a 'Classic' Big4. It's an older campground with simple amenities. With that in mind, my stay (with my 10 year old) was excellent and great value for money. The staff are the loveliest, and the place was spotlessly clean.

Our cabin had 2 beds and they were nicely made with comfortable mattresses, bedding and lots of pillows. There were warm fluffy blankets in the wardrobe and we loved them. The kitchen was well equipped, much better than I thought. There was ample crockery, plenty of pots and pans, and all the utensils I needed.
The unit doesn't have a full oven (it has a hob and microwave) so i used the shared Camp Kitchen and was impressed - great oven, all the utensils I could ever need, and very clean.

The shared bathrooms which are adjacent to the cabin I stayed in were perfectly adequate and very clean all the time.

The swimming pool is FREEZING. I can't work out how it was so cold but it did not stop children swimming in it. The loungers around the pool were great for me and other parents to lie in and supervise. It was great to see staff pass by every half hour and check to make sure everything was okay in the pool area.

One unexpected highlight was the DVD library in the games room. Our cabin had a DVD player and my child had never seen a DVD in real life. We watched a few movies and really enjoyed the experience - its a great range of DVDs. Plus I found a good book in the collection to read.

It's worth noting that the park has quite a lot of permanent residents in caravans with lean-tos. They were friendly and the park was quiet. It was a surprise, I hadn't seen that before, but it was not a problem. We slept well and heard nothing in the night. There is plenty of car parking.

I loved my get away to Big4 Midland and will be back. As long as future visitors remember it is a 'Classic' park, it should meet all your expectations. Being a 'Classic' it is great value for money! We paid $118 per night in the peak school holiday period and it was totally worth it.
showerReviews.author: Jessie McIlroy

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Coogee Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: I don't usually leave reviews but I feel I need to add some positive feedback. Some of those I read prior to our visit were very negative. James was most helpful in finding us a site for an extra night on arrival. He put us on a lovely large concrete slab, very welcome considering the rain we've had. He also came over & offered to securely store our bikes. While the amenities may be old, they're clean & have good hot showers. The location is great too, close to the beach, cafes & Fremantle. We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay here
showerReviews.author: Deb Hoggan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Let’s be clear — this is not a 4-star hotel, more like a 1 or 2-star motel. Don't know exactly how this place is rated 4 star.  No way in the world near that standard.

If you arrive after hours, good luck finding your cabin — no clear signs, no lighting, and very poor directions. The rooms are basic, with no toiletries like shampoo or shower gel. There’s even a note telling guests to wash their own dishes and messy room otherwise there will be additinal charges which is ridiculous for a hotel.

No daily cleaning, broken TV remote, and paper-thin walls where you hear everything from next door even a drop of a pin

On top of that, the reception keeps sending text messages throughout your stay, which just adds to the frustration. Instead of feeling welcomed, it felt intrusive and uncomfortable — like being constantly monitored rather than cared for.

For $150–$200 a night, it’s overpriced, noisy, and disappointing. Definitely not worth it — book somewhere else.
showerReviews.author: RB

locations.title: Karrinyup Waters Resort

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just spent 2 werks here
Great location, shady areas, great play areas for kids. The pool is fantastic, plenty of seats, lounges and shade.  We stayed in one of the small open planned cabins with one queen and bunks. The mattresses are uncomfortable foam. There is a horrible odour that seeps out of the shower recess. The cafe food was horrible,  greasy and overcooked. The worse hospitality reception staff I have ever come across, frosty and snappy. They happen to be the reason I would never come back.

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed there for a week and used the resort as a base for day trips into the city and surrounding area. The resort is quite nice, with various restrooms in varying condition. Make sure you find the newest one with nice rain showers. There are various playgrounds for children in the area; our kids loved them. The pool area was also nice, but the key fobs didn't work properly, which is very annoying when trying to get in through the gate. Unfortunately, we were at a campsite at the end of the park near the forest, and all the stuff was falling from the trees.

showerReviews.reviewText: Hidden gem that needs a polish. We stayed here for three nights recently. Can see that things have been let go a bit but also improvements seem to be happening. Great location and super quiet, very close to shopping centre (walking distance). Absolutely no issues with the permanents on site who are more up the back of the park. Amenities block needs some work however relatively clean with good shower pressure. Given the age of the park can see it's a work in progress. Staff were fantastic to deal with and very accommodating. Overall would stay again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having stayed in several carparks as a part of my travels, I was horrified and disgusted with the filth in our rental cottage.  While the sheets were clean, the bathroom shower had so much grime I was concerned about getting a foot fungus and showered at the home of people we were visiting.  I understand it isn't a hotel, but for this to be listed as an option on Bookings.com in the price range of $150-$170 a night, a clean room is not a lot to ask for and I would never have thought about it not being clean.  The floors were so filthy my socks were black.

The car park does offer some services for those who are renting space for their campers, but the lots and public areas are not maintained.

I wanted to share this so the owners can take action and for travelers who are seeking a place to sleep they understand what they are getting and have very low expectations, especially for the price.

I wish I could post pictures so you could see it for yourself.
showerReviews.author: Diane Cashin

showerReviews.reviewText:
An absolute shambles of an accomodation, do not waste your time booking here! There is far better alternatives!! A cabin with a blind that fell down the first night, taps that hardly worked in the ensuite (required you to fiddle with the taps to get running water) Lino that had various tears and bubbles, the flooring near the kitchen sink that felt like it was going to cave in at any moment and disgustingly filthy throughout.. Oh, and how’s this? A disassembled pedestal fan on the top of the wardrobe in case you get a little hot, covered in filth.. It also makes me wonder if the bed linen is ever washed from person to person or if cleaning practices are upheld (maybe a phone call to the City of Wanneroo) and Department of Health is required to check your procedures are up to date and aligned to what you’re charging people. I have written to the shire in regards to a non functioning fire alarm, which is illegal to have guests stay in a self contained room / accomodation with a kitchen without one working or at least tested, per your comments, no we didn’t raise this with reception because testing of your facilities and its amenities should be your priority! Do not reply to this review with arrogance or I will take matters further!

I strongly urge people to avoid Acclaim Tourist Parks KIngsway at all costs!!! Absolute joke of a place.
showerReviews.author: Brooklyn Scott

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived at the front drop off, we were treated like royalty. Check in was smooth, and lady at desk was extremely friendly and so nice, she gave us a free room upgrade because it was my sons birthday, thank you so much for that.
Room was immaculate, nice large bathroom with deep bath tub and nice hot shower. The whole hotel is just beautiful, and the view from our room was wonderful. Pool area is amazing, and bonus that the pool is heated. I look forward to return very soon, The Ritz Carlton is now my favourite perth hotel.

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Woodman Point

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed last night for 1 night at the end of our 2 week WA family holiday and tbh I'm glad it was only one night. Out of all the caravan parks we've stayed at this was the most expensive but nowhere near as good of amenities/things to offer. The pool says closed after dark which is fair however we walked over at 5.30pm still daylight and the pools locked, the games room has a pool table & ping-pong table but you haveto get the stuff from reception which once again closes at 5pm, the playground has no seating for adults around, the swings and flying fox has been taken out aswell. In a toilet block there's only 3 toilets which everytime I went was either out of toilet paper or the paper was stuck- hubby said had great shower pressure tho. Camp kitchen is very small in comparison. Also being woken up at 7am in the morning to a tree chipper is a great way to start the day- NOT.
showerReviews.author: Ashley Lucas

Had a late check in, no worries at all, check in staff were great. Location good, park overall nice, my main issue was the camp kitchen, firstly doesn’t open until 7am, hmmm 7:10 rolls around and it’s casually open, however not cleaned. Food scrapes everywhere, tables dirty. For the amount of money charged for a site, to then wait for a camp kitchen to open?! You would think it would be cleaned before it’s open, otherwise why lock it! We have been traveling WA for 4 weeks and this is the first locked one and the most unclean one.
Also WiFi doesn’t work.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed at Rockingham Holiday Village. Upon checking in, I was directed to a cabin down First Avenue. The first thing I noticed was a pile of rubbish and furniture on the slab across from our room. I parked my car and walked up the decking, noticing that it was rotten and broken in parts, leading up to the front door, and the stair rail was also rotten and loose. I had my ageing parents come to visit us, and my dad nearly fell over on the broken parts of the decking. Upon opening the front door, all I could smell was smoke and stale air, like the room hadn’t been aired out after the previous guests left. The unit was basically clean, but it didn’t look like it had been thoroughly cleaned after the last check-out. For a room with one double bed and a bunk that sleeps three, there were only four pillows, no extra bedding in the cupboards, and no extra blankets anywhere. I went to collect my husband and children from sport and returned. When I tried to put something in the pantry, I found a beanie which I thought was odd. I checked it and saw cigarettes inside; upon further inspection, I found drug paraphernalia and a significant amount of marijuana. I considered calling the police but decided to leave it to the front office. I went over and couldn’t find anyone, so I called the after-hours number and got no reply, so I decided to wait until morning.
We had planned to cook a BBQ dinner because many families from our son’s baseball club were staying there, and we thought it would be a great evening for the kids to bond. However, the BBQs were broken and unusable. That evening, my husband tried to lock the front door, but the lock kept turning in the handle, and he couldn’t lock it from inside, so he had to lock it from outside with the key. The next morning, we had to go out the back door to unlock the front door. The floor in the shower felt like it was collapsing, and the tiles around it were sinking. Honestly, we pay the same price for more nights at Karrinyup Waters Resort, where it’s clean, well-maintained, and comfortable. We didn’t feel that way there—the beds felt like we’d be bitten all night and need updating. We won’t stay there again. The staff were great and apologetic when I raised my concerns. While I understand there are new owners, the lawns hadn’t been mowed in what seemed like months, the units need definite updating and a really good clean.
Another family I spoke to who had a little baby were told that there was no cot for the baby and they would have to go out and buy their own.  When you offer a service you need to deliver.
showerReviews.author: Taylor & Jessica Rowe

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stored our groceries in the caravan park’s fridge, but everything was gone. We had bought a lot of food the day before and hadn’t used any of it yet. The same thing happened at another caravan park, so our food was stolen two days in a row.

We started our road trip about four months ago from the east of Australia and have stayed in every state, and nothing like this has ever happened before. This was our first time experiencing food theft – and it happened twice.

At caravan parks in other states, some places have rules about locking the camp kitchen at a certain time. After experiencing this theft, we felt upset and powerless, knowing there was nothing we could do. Even though there are CCTVs installed, they didn’t seem to help.

I think better security measures should be considered to prevent other visitors from having the same unpleasant experience.
showerReviews.author: EW

locations.title: Perth Hills Discovery Centre Campground

showerReviews.reviewText:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
One of the best campgrounds near Perth – clean, quiet, and perfect for beginners or seasoned campers!

We stayed at Discovery Hill Campground in Beelu National Park and were blown away by how well-maintained, peaceful, and comfortable it was. It’s just under an hour from Perth, but you feel like you’ve completely escaped into the bush.

🛁 Facilities are excellent – hot showers, clean long-drop toilets, and drinking water available on-site.
🍳 The communal kitchen is fantastic – two gas barbecues, a sink with running water, fridge, prep benches, and plenty of space to cook and relax.
🔥 Fire pits are everywhere! Almost every corner of the site has one, and they’re perfect for cold nights (check fire season restrictions).
📶 Strong 5G signal throughout the area – we were surprised how good the internet was for such a remote-feeling location!

The campground is surrounded by jarrah and marri trees, giving it a true bush feel. We saw kangaroos at sunrise and heard kookaburras every morning. It’s incredibly peaceful and spacious, with well-separated sites for privacy.

If you’re new to camping and want to try it out before investing in gear or heading somewhere remote, this is the ideal beginner-friendly location. You still get the full outdoor experience but with comforts that make it easy and enjoyable.

🙌 Also, make sure to say hello to Mark, the campground caretaker – he’s a legend! Friendly, helpful, and keeps everything running smoothly. He even gave us tips on the best walking trails.

🥾 Walking and hiking options nearby are amazing:
•	A short walk from the campground leads to Lake O’Connor, with stunning views over the hills and plenty of birdlife.
•	You’re right near parts of the Bibbulmun Track – you can do day hikes to Kalamunda, or even link up with longer trails toward Albany.
•	There are also short loop trails around the park if you’re just after a gentle walk.

This place is a real gem for solo campers, couples, and families alike. Peaceful nights, starry skies, friendly vibe, and a great mix of nature and convenience.

We saw kangaroos at dawn, enjoyed bushwalks during the day, and had a peaceful night under the stars. Whether you’re a family, a solo adventurer, or a first-time camper looking to try it out, Discovery Hill is a hidden gem. We’ll definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: jigme yonten chhogyal

showerReviews.reviewText: Although I am not a fan of this campsite, I will give credit where it’s due. Great for camping if you have kids or little ones and it’s just up the road from the Mundaring Weir Hotel, CY O’Connor lookout and the Dam. Plus no park fees payable except for camping fees. Showers and toilets available as well as a camp kitchen with fridge! Campsites 1 to 8 are better as they look out toward the trees although sites 7 and 8 are close to the camp kitchen. Don’t rely on the mud map on the website, it is really not to scale! We were on site 11 and site 10 was literally less than 5 steps away from us. Use the lookout near the campsite (on mud map) for a nice brekky area if the camp kitchen gets too crowded. Campground backs onto the Bib Track so it’s convenient for walkers and hikers. There are camp hosts there in the caravan at the entrance to sign you in and they have a trolley to help you move your camping gear to your site. There is absolutely no drive through for vehicles. I found this campsite nice but not private enough but may return to short one or two night stays and NOT during the school holidays! That being said the campers were pretty considerate when we were there and all was pretty much silent around 9.40pm but this could be our unique experience so don’t rely fully on it! :)
showerReviews.author: V Lee

showerReviews.reviewText: Great camping getaway for a night or two. Not far from Perth CBD (approx 45 mins). Facilities include showers and toilet blocks. There’s a kitchen area with an electric kettle, toaster, fridge and freezer, and two park-style gas BBQs. Makes for a simple camping trip and I found the grounds and facilities well-kept and clean. Campfires allowed in concrete fire pits when there are no bans. I brought my own firewood but the camp hosts had bags of jarrah for sale. Perfect camping option for families and even younger children. You can’t drive directly to the campsite so if you have a lot of stuff consider bringing a wheelbarrow or cart to help tote your gear from the car park. Otherwise it’s not too far to carry things if you pack relatively light.
showerReviews.author: Kyle Springer
