locations.title: Advent Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quite the experience for first timer as the site facilities were super nice. Really quiet and safe for camping. Plenty space for tent and camper van or caravan underneath huge trees. Lot of birds and fresh air in the morning, plenty shade and open spaces for playing.

Beautiful kitchen with lot of dinning space and very nice and clean bathrooms with hot strong shower.

There are rooms available if you prefer but staying in camp was the best experience.

Centrally located along the plains of Maida vale closer to Kalamunda hills and quick drive to City or Airport.

The park is well established and cleaned, hips of appreciation and Willis love to come again with family and friends.

If you looking for some adventure but not quite sure how to begin, come here and stay a night or two, you won’t be disappointed.

showerReviews.reviewText: Tranquil bush setting, great for families and nature lovers. The lake is perfect for kayaking and morning walks, with clean facilities and friendly staff. Spacious sites, native wildlife, and relaxed vibes make it a top pick for a peaceful weekend escape.

showerReviews.reviewText: Lake Leschenaultia Camp Site is a fantastic destination for both day trips and extended stays. Nestled in the picturesque Perth Hills, this serene spot offers a variety of activities, including swimming, kayaking, and cycling. The well-maintained campgrounds provide excellent facilities, including clean restrooms and BBQ areas. With its beautiful natural surroundings and ample recreational options, Lake Leschenaultia is perfect for families, nature enthusiasts, and anyone looking to unwind in a peaceful setting.
showerReviews.author: Steven Manook

showerReviews.reviewText:
Never seen a campsite so beautiful and clean.

Showers, toilet and powered sites.

The lady at the office welcomed with a big smile and friendliness.

2 mins walk from our site no.11 to the lake.

Beautiful Birds and love the G'day vibes in the morning.

Campers very respectful and kept noise to the minimum.

Lake to swim, kayak and relax. Also cycling tracks and hiking trails.

Thankyou will visit whenever I get availability.

showerReviews.reviewText: Good facilities (hot showers, clean toilets, camp kitchen, flat pitches and fire pits at each pitch). Great view around the Lake and great price! Especially as we’re in low season. Staff communicated well with us and were friendly. Lovely little powered site. Wasn’t sure if there was water to fill up van (I didn’t check). The showers could be a bit more powerful but for the price and location, was lovely and I would recommend.

locations.title: Henry White Oval Campground
locations.address: Corner of Indian Ocean Drive and, Yanchep Beach Rd, Yanchep WA 6035

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the best camp amenities wise of the west coast no joke. First the bathroom is amazing very clean, the shower is incredible a lot of pressure and hot water.
There is an area with sinks and barbecues sort of and PLUGS very convenient.
In the morning around 7, there was kangaroos everywhere around us. There is a lot of space for kids to play. And it’s so close to the koala trail. We went like 3 times to see them more active later in the days and early in the next day.
showerReviews.author: Emilie Gaspar

showerReviews.reviewText:
We thoroughly recommend Henry White Oval , it's close proximity to Yanchep Lagoon and only 10 mins to the train station to visit Perth.
The national park is beautifully laid out with walking trails , adventure parks and caves.
We visited the Yanchep Inn a couple of times for dinner and lunch . The ambience out the back beer garden is lovely , with really friendly staff and a chilled atmosphere,  we really enjoyed it.
The lay out of Henry White is well spaced , the tarmac sites would be more suitable to only motor homes and roof top tents. The other area is excellent , the bathrooms are super clean , water is hot and pressure good. Camp kitchen has BBQ and hot n cold water.. Overall very impressed
showerReviews.author: Steven Lawrence

showerReviews.reviewText: Super nice campground. Toilets and showers are exceptional clean and modern. Hot water available. Camp hosts are super friendly and gave us recommendations what to do/see in the area. Kangaroos jumping around and lots of birds to observe

showerReviews.reviewText: I honestly don’t understand the good reviews. The entire camp is infested with Portuguese millipedes—you don’t even know where to step. It felt like a horror movie: floors, walls, even the ceiling above you. In the toilets, in the showers, and all over the campgrounds. I just wanted to leave. It was a nightmare. I have never experienced anything so terrible in my life.
showerReviews.author: Andrea

showerReviews.reviewText: The Henry White Oval Campground is a very pleasant stay in the Yanchep National Park. The camping is self contained only, there is no electric hookup available and generators are only allowed on tarmac pitches. That said, there are many beautiful walks, treetop adventure ground, cave walks and Kangaroos everywhere! The price is fairly hefty considering the lack of power, etc and there is a national park fee on top of that. This is made up for by the park facilities that are available, including the Yanchep Inn which is a short walk from the campground. The camp hosts are very helpful and there is a fire pit which is lit each evening, season permitting, and is a central meeting place for camp visitors. The kitchen facilities are clean and plentiful, two barbecues, washing up sinks with hot water and large covered seating area also make this a great social point. The toilet block has hot showers and well serviced disabled toilet, all cleaned daily between 10:00 and 11:00. Finally, the Gravity Discovery Center is less than half an hour away and is a great visit for children and adults alike.
showerReviews.author: Will Burchell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely small unpowered/self contained camping in the beautiful Yanchep National Park. Immaculate amenities (flushing toilets, showers, powered camp kitchen etc. Communal fire pit with roaming kangaroos. It’s a great safe spot for families with young children. Lots of space to run around/ ride bikes and explore. We also visited the treetop adventures which was excellent.
The camp hosts were very informative and did an amazing job of maintaining the amenities. It was obvious they loved their job! We have already booked to go back.
showerReviews.author: Tara Farmer

locations.title: Walyunga Campground

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros

- An intimate place to go camping to; there are five camp sites and one bathroom (no shower).
- Each camp site’s got a fire pit for bonfire.
- It’s gated and closes at 5pm but you’ll receive a code for the gate through email if you book it online.
- It’s very close to the city/surrounding suburbs yet not too close as it still feels very nature-y.
- There are heaps of places to visit around the area.

Cons

- They lock two gates at night, one of which cannot be unlocked by campers, which means when you need to leave at night (eg. emergency), you can’t. But on the bright side, you could think of it as additional security 🤷‍♀️

- You cannot get a hold of staff after 5pm on weekdays and not at all on weekends for queries/assistance.
showerReviews.author: Diane Pepano Sulayao

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely experience, near by the city with a good camping site demarcation. Lots of space between sites. Every camp spot has a table and a firepit. Drop toilet, no shower. Syd's rapid is a nice spot for a walk. The only problem is that the gate requires a code for access but it's only provide it by phone during office hours, and I did my booking on a Saturday. Lucky I saw a volunteer after few hours I was on the park. Would definitely recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Perfect location close to airport and other site seeing locations.
40 minutes on bus to city or quicker by train.
Staff are very helpful and friendly.
Shopping centre 1km down the road.
Catch the 270 or 280 bus to get there every 30 minutes.
Pool and games room with cinema over weekends for families.
There are a variety of cabin's and a lawn areas to pitch a tent.
Bathrooms and laundry close by.
Public Kitchen available with oven's.

Powered sites for your caravan  with your own amenities.

We enjoyed our stay and thank the staff for their support during our stay.

locations.title: Britannia On William

showerReviews.reviewText: This hostel is the worst, dirtiest, and worst in all of Perth. I've had countless bad experiences at this hostel. First of all, the staff were unfriendly. (I'm not sure if she's still working there, but there was one Asian woman with a nose piercing‼️ I've lived abroad a long time, but I've never seen anyone with such a strong personality. Her working days overlapped with my check-out days, and she was so irritating, she would drain my energy within minutes.) They ignored my greetings, didn't even explain anything about the hostel, and just demanded in a strong tone, "Pay your deposit!!" However, I never got my deposit back, and as soon as I arrived at the room, it was just filthy. It was cold that day, but there was no air conditioning. The futon was as thin as a towel blanket. There were no windows in the four-person room, and it was dark, like midnight, even though it was daytime. There was a vent, but the room was full of dust and mold, making it an unbearable environment. If I had stayed there a few more days, I would have had a nervous breakdown.  My roommate, a large black woman, was racist. She treated me as if I, an Japanese, were not even human. Furthermore, during my stay at the hostel, I was persistently stalked by a Korean man, which shocked me and made me feel unsafe. I asked the reception to change my room, but they completely ignored my request. I can't believe it. There's also a nightclub nearby, which makes it very noisy at night, the washing machine is coin-operated despite being modern, and the toilets are only open between 8am and 9am! Who would want to live in a hostel like this? At the very least, I'll never use this hostel again‼️
showerReviews.author: SAWA o

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you're nostalgic for the good old days of Windows 95, dial-up internet, and questionable plumbing, then this backpackers might be right up your alley. The whole place feels like it hasn't seen an update since the late 90s — and that includes the facilities, the furniture, and definitely the Wi-Fi.

Speaking of Wi-Fi, don't expect to stream, scroll, or even load a basic webpage from your room. The signal is so weak it practically vanishes unless you’re standing outside in the courtyard, which ironically has the best internet reception. Because nothing says “modern travel” like huddling outdoors for a signal in 2025.

The rooms are cramped, the beds creak with every breath, and the "view" is… well, just don't expect one. A few of the taps and showers are broken or barely functioning, and everything from the toilets to the kitchen appliances screams "budget hostel, circa 1997."

Oh, and let’s talk about the key situation. Yes, an actual physical key (remember those?). No keycards here — just old-school metal and a $40 deposit for something that probably cost $2 to cut at the hardware store.

The staff were nice enough, and the location is decent with transport nearby — but that's about where the praise ends. For what you're paying, you'd expect at least basic functionality, if not a hint of modernization.

Honestly, this place needs a serious reboot — preferably one that doesn't involve floppy disks.
showerReviews.author: Faisal Durran

locations.title: Perth City Backpackers Hostel

showerReviews.reviewText:
This backpacker hostel is very friendly, and Jérémy will make you feel comfortable from the moment you arrive. If he can help you, he definitely will. There is a common room that is generally clean because there is a $20 deposit system: if you don’t wash or dry your dishes, your deposit is automatically taken. This encourages everyone to keep the place tidy.

The common area is spacious, with a pool table, a TV and comfortable leather couches. There is also a separate gaming room with an Xbox that you can use anytime. The dining area has around twenty chairs with several small tables and three large tables for groups. Another cosy pool-table corner is available as well, with soft velvet couches everywhere.

The hostel is calm and respectful. After 10 PM, noise is not allowed, which is perfect for people who work and need good sleep. From 10 PM to 8 AM, the rule is silence, and everyone respects it.

Showers are cleaned every morning by a staff member. In the men’s area, there are 3 showers, 3 toilets, 2 sinks with mirrors and another sink without one. Everything is relatively clean.

There is a large outdoor courtyard with an open cabana where you can relax on comfortable leather sofas. The hostel also has an outdoor parking area where you can safely park your car. The environment feels secure.

Every week, many job offers are posted, and there is a strong sense of mutual help between the guests. Everyone is friendly and respectful. This place does not have a bad reputation at all — quite the opposite. Friends of mine stayed in other backpackers around Perth and they all told me this one deserves at least an 8.5/10. Some other hostels struggle with cleanliness and safety, but not this one.

I highly recommend this backpacker hostel because you won’t find a better value for money. It’s the perfect place for a first experience in Australia. There are rooms of 4, 8, 12, and 16 beds with good people, and the place is both clean and peaceful. A great environment to start your Australian adventure the right way.
showerReviews.author: shuma reur

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely not! The kitchens are filthy, the sofas half-broken, and the air-conditioning in the room doesn't work, which is a real problem with 40°C outside. Worse still, it leaked onto our belongings.

Worst of all was the bedbug infestation, and reception did nothing except offer to pay for washing machines. As for the breakfast included, it was derisory.

Despite some nice encounters that made the stay more pleasant, the hostel is far too expensive ($350 a week) for such mediocre services, and bedbugs!!! We're still trying to get rid of them!
showerReviews.author: Marine Bourtoule

showerReviews.reviewText:
I can't comply with the previous less than 3* reviews, even tho not all rooms are the same value for money.

The allocated 4-bed room, which I had booked for 50 A$ / night, featured a window and an A/C. There's space under the beds for luggage, and each guest has their own locker in the room.
The rooms can only be opened with the corresponding key.

The hostel entrance is also reserved for guests only, accessed through a code, making it very secure.

The location is good; although it's a 20-minute walk to the main train station, there's a free CAT bus of the red line, that stops almost directly outside the facility door.

The large communal kitchen table invites meeting other backpackers. Cleaning regulations and regular cleaning by the staff keeps everything hygienic.

Following the rules, it's expected to be quiet after 10 PM, as it's not a party hostel.

The bathrooms, separate for ladies and gentlemen, are regularly cleaned. Those are modern, with sufficient shower stalls and toilet cabins. The mirrors serve their purpose well.

Relaxing, safe, and worry-free stay. Thank you.
showerReviews.author: Elli

showerReviews.reviewText: After living in this hostel for six months, I can say that despite a lack of certain amenities, it’s a great place overall. However, I want to point out that what really made this hostel enjoyable was the friendly, laid-back backpacker atmosphere. Unfortunately, that has changed since the arrival of a new staff member, Steven, who constantly acts like a police officer and, on top of that, is not even capable of doing his job properly (booking issues, misunderstandings, removing my belongings for no reason…). This person has ruined the warm, welcoming vibe that made people want to stay here.
showerReviews.author: hugo martinez

Suggestions for improvement:
- Curtains for the beds – they would make the room look tidier, since we wouldn’t need to use sheets and towels as makeshift curtains. We would still be able to socialise either way.
- Presence lights.
- Extra hangers in the showers – at the moment each shower has only one hanger, but ideally there should be at least two (one for clean clothes and another for used clothes + towel).
- Hangers in the room – to allow us to hang wet towels.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a wonderful stay at this hostel. It offers excellent value for money, and is conveniently located just a 10–15 minute walk from the CBD. I stayed for two weeks, and, as it was my first hostel experience, I was initially a bit apprehensive. However, those concerns quickly disappeared. The property was exceptionally clean, and the staff were incredibly welcoming. A special thank you to Eve, who checked me in, and made sure I had everything I needed.

The kitchen facilities were outstanding. There was a full, industrial-sized kitchen, with two large ovens, and plenty of food preparation space. The common areas, both indoors and outdoors, were also excellent—comfortable, spacious, and perfect for relaxing or socialising.

The overall atmosphere was friendly, and fellow guests were respectful and quiet. The only downside was the limited number of bathrooms—just two toilets, and three showers—which could be a little inconvenient in the mornings. That said, I understand renovations are currently underway, so I hope to see improvements in that area soon.

Overall, a fantastic experience. I would gladly stay here again.
showerReviews.author: Billy Paterson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros

Staff were friendly and helpful despite limited English and presence, tried returning several times after my stay to collect post and nobody was available

Very good location, right in the middle of the city and walking distance to everything you need

One of the cheapest hostels in the area

Cons

Bedsheets were stained, yes its a backpackers hostel but clean sheets should be bare minimum. Asked for new sheets and got them but it does leave a bad taste

The building is so noisy, footsteps are loud and doors don't close gently, also they shake other doors/windows in their frames

WiFi is extremely poor, if this is your first time in the country it is very frustrating trying to set up your cards/numbers/etc and simple google searches don't load

A staff member opened the door to our private room while I was sleeping in the morning, did not feel safe leaving my possessions in the room after this

Feels cheap to complain about bathrooms in a hostel but they could definitely have been cleaned more often, also no towels/paper towels/hand driers

Owner can feel free to leave her retorts under this review but they should really give you a good indication of how they run the place. Most of the bad reviews were apparently kicked out for noise but we stayed for a full legitimate week, you get what you pay for just be warned if this is your first stay in Australia.
showerReviews.author: Thomas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros

Staff were friendly and helpful despite limited English and presence, tried returning several times after my stay to collect post and nobody was available

Very good location, right in the middle of the city and walking distance to everything you need

One of the cheapest hostels in the area

Cons

Bedsheets were stained, yes its a backpackers hostel but clean sheets should be bare minimum. Asked for new sheets and got them but it does leave a bad taste

The building is so noisy, footsteps are loud and doors don't close gently, also they shake other doors/windows in their frames

WiFi is extremely poor, if this is your first time in the country it is very frustrating trying to set up your cards/numbers/etc and simple google searches don't load

A staff member opened the door to our private room while I was sleeping in the morning, did not feel safe leaving my possessions in the room after this

Feels cheap to complain about bathrooms in a hostel but they could definitely have been cleaned more often, also no towels/paper towels/hand driers

Owner can feel free to leave her retorts under this review but they should really give you a good indication of how they run the place. Most of the bad reviews were apparently kicked out for noise but we stayed for a full legitimate week, you get what you pay for just be warned if this is your first stay in Australia.
showerReviews.author: Thomas

showerReviews.reviewText: The rooms were very basic and the walls were quite dirty, the mattress was also unclean and it didn’t feel that safe either. . Some of the facilities could have been improved however such as the amount of washing machines as the staff were also using the guests washing machines. However the staff were friendly and very helpful. The toilets were pretty clean but the kitchen was also quite dirty.

locations.title: The Shiralee Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friends and I stayed at this hostel for three nights. The first two nights were fine; however, the experience on the final night, which was a Saturday, was completely different.

If you are looking for a hostel with a quiet and peaceful environment on Friday or Saturday nights, this may not be the best option. You should go to other hostels near the area where the owner has firm control in this matter, such as Billabong Backpackers Resort Hostel. I was quite sad to learn about this hostel from my friend.

I was informed by staff that ‘It’s always hard to control on a Friday and Saturday night.’ What made the situation worse was that even the person in charge appeared unable or unwilling to manage the noise. After I finished taking a shower and had to walk through the kitchen and living area, one of the residents stared at me, made a loud “shushing” gesture, and encouraged others to do the same. I found this intimidating and inappropriate, particularly because it seemed clear they knew I had reported the noise. This has never happened on any other night. If the owner reviews the CCTV footage, it should confirm that I am describing the incident accurately. Additionally, I have already messaged the owner about the residents’ behaviour, but I have not received any response.

If you value a respectful environment or expect staff to protect guests’ right to rest, this is not the place. Guests who raise legitimate concerns about noise should not feel harassed as a result.
showerReviews.author: Sukjai P.

locations.title: Wallaby Backpackers Hostel Perth

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was by far the worst hostel I’ve ever stayed in. The room was shockingly dirty, it looked and smelled like it hadn’t been cleaned in years (in other hostels, rooms are cleaned every morning). I found old socks and belongings from previous guests next to my bed, and there was dust and dirt everywhere.

I felt so uncomfortable that I only came back to sleep and avoided all common areas entirely. I didn’t even bother checking out the kitchen or lounge.

The only positive thing I can say is that the toilets were relatively clean.

I tried to cancel and get my money back, but that wasn’t possible. If you care even a little about hygiene or comfort, I strongly recommend staying elsewhere.

If I said some of the words that come to mind when I think of the bathroom I would probably get banned. It smelt like hell on earth. Showers looked like they had been puked on. Don’t think they had been cleaned in a long time. You could smell the bathrooms from the end of one corridor. Absolutely disgusting!!!! Only positive was the location was very good. Would not stay again👍

locations.title: John Tognela Rest Area

showerReviews.reviewText:
John Tognela Rest Area, a hidden gem nestled in the vast landscapes of Western Australia. This humble rest area is not just a pit stop for weary travelers, but a haven of respite and tranquility that offers a glimpse into the rugged beauty of the region.

As you pull into the rest area, the vastness of the surrounding landscape immediately captivates you. The untamed wilderness stretches as far as the eye can see, with rolling hills, towering trees, and a sense of serenity that is both humbling and awe-inspiring. It's a place where time seems to slow down, allowing you to disconnect from the chaos of the world and reconnect with nature.

The amenities at John Tognela Rest Area are simple yet sufficient. Picnic tables invite you to sit down and enjoy a meal amidst the natural splendor, while clean restroom facilities provide a brief respite from the journey. But it's the surroundings that truly steal the show. The air is crisp and fragrant, carrying whispers of eucalyptus and wildflowers. The sounds of birds chirping and leaves rustling create a soothing symphony, as if nature itself is putting on a private performance just for you.

Take a moment to explore the area on foot, and you'll discover hidden trails that lead you deeper into the wilderness. Wander through groves of ancient trees, their branches reaching towards the heavens as if trying to touch the sky. Breathe in the earthy scent of the forest floor, where wildflowers bloom in vibrant hues, creating a tapestry of color that is a feast for the eyes.

But it's not just the natural beauty that sets John Tognela Rest Area apart. It's the spirit of camaraderie and community that permeates the space. Fellow travelers exchange stories and tips, sharing a sense of adventure and a common appreciation for the road less traveled. Strangers become friends as they gather around a campfire, sharing laughter and tales of their journeys.

As the sun begins its descent, painting the sky in hues of orange and gold, the rest area transforms into a magical place. The stars emerge one by one, twinkling in the vast expanse above, casting a soft glow on the landscape below. It's a reminder of the infinite possibilities that lie beyond the horizon, and the beauty that can be found in the simplest of moments.

John Tognela Rest Area is not just a place to rest your weary bones; it's a place to rejuvenate your spirit. It's a reminder that the journey is just as important as the destination, and that sometimes the most memorable experiences are found in the spaces in between. So, if you find yourself traveling through Western Australia, make a point to visit John Tognela Rest Area. Let its natural beauty and peaceful ambiance wrap around you like a warm embrace, and let it remind you of the wonders that await on the open road.
showerReviews.author: Enz

showerReviews.reviewText: I visited to ask if I could reheat my own food, as I’ve done on other Bp. Unfortunately, I was told no — apparently because they now have a restaurant and expect customers to purchase their food instead, which I found to be overpriced and not particularly fresh. It’s disappointing to see that they’ve removed the microwave that was once available for drivers, especially when many rely on such basic amenities during long journeys. The management’s decision reflects a lack of consideration for regular patrons and the needs of road users. Very dissatisfied with how this location is now being operated
showerReviews.author: Inderpreet Singh

showerReviews.reviewText:
Review is regarding Aged care Home Care Package management.
I am seriously ill with heart and lung problems and no family to care for me. Living in total isolation, I need constant assistance and care from my Home Care Package.
I am very unhappy with the management from St Barts for my level 4 HCP. They were very quick to send OT to assess my needs, but those needs were not met. Continuing failure to respond to phone messages, text, or email left me feel there was a passive resistance to managing my care, yet fees were always deducted.
Simple things like a shower chair took months to supply!
Quoted $2,500 to install 2 PowerPoint's that a reputable electrician installed for $450!
Something really is not right here.
Having said that, my carers were A1. Fabulous caring women, I am sorry to lose them, but I need an experienced HCP, not one that management failed me time and time again.
I have a need for a high level of care, yet my service was often cancelled, with only
minutes or no notice at all. Not once was I asked if I was ok without help and offered an alternative time.
Understaffed and inexperienced, uncaring management. It is a definite no from me.
showerReviews.author: Ruth Hammer

locations.title: Cove Spa

showerReviews.reviewText: I recently got in touch with Cove Spa to book for my family from the UK while on holidays here in Perth. I arranged to have some treatments for my 2 sisters and mother. Everything about the experience was brilliant. The reception staff were so friendly and accommodating, they went above and beyond to find a suitable booking for me. My family were greeted by the happiest staff they said they have ever come across and were shown into a lovely relaxation area to enjoy drinks and nibbles before and after their treatments. The spa rooms were decadent with showers and baths and the massage beds were warm and comfortable. Their massages and facials were the best my family have ever had and each of their therapists were so professional and extremely knowledgeable. They said "all the therapists have magic healing hands" and they felt as if they had left as completely new women! They actually organised to visit Cove again once more before flying home to the UK. The whole process was 5 star quality and i would highly recommend anyone to visit Cove Spa, I certainly will be sending friends and family to Cove again.
showerReviews.author: Adam Parsons

locations.title: Life and Soul at the Mayfair

showerReviews.reviewText:
A huge thank you to Hayley, Tijana, and the entire team at Life and Soul at The Mayfair for making me feel so welcome and for helping me set up a membership that suited my time in the area. I was comparing a few gyms, but after seeing the quality of the facilities here, I didn’t need to look any further.

The 24/7 gym located on the second floor is absolutely beautiful. The layout and use of space is excellent, the lighting and décor very stylish, and all equipment is in outstanding condition and kept very clean. There is also a reformer Pilates studio offering both self-guided sessions and instructor-led classes.

The Wellness facilities are a standout, with an infrared sauna, a dry sauna, and two Odin ice baths available for private 45 minute sessions. The toilets and change rooms are spotless and well maintained. On the ground floor, The Yard Fremantle offers functional training classes focused on endurance and strength building, which is a great bonus.

They also have a well-stocked range of merchandise, including clothing and supplements. After-hours Bluetooth access to different areas is incredibly easy and convenient.

Overall, an exceptional gym with top-tier facilities and a welcoming, professional team. I highly recommend Life and Soul at The Mayfair for anyone wanting to kickstart their fitness journey 💪❤️
showerReviews.author: Leecie DB

locations.title: SpeedFit Fremantle

showerReviews.reviewText: What an awesome session and none i ever before have experienced! Far from your traditional workouts, having tried ‘SpeedFit’ seems like the way to go - when you are constantly ‘on-the-go’! A Full workout within 20-30mins!? It Sounds Cliche, but I highly recommend giving it a ‘go’ for yourselves! Mr.G (the Owner) is SUPER friendly, informative and helpful, he is a wealth of knowledge and has made our experience and the environment fun and comfortable, it was super easy for us to download the process. Everything is supplied from the towels, body suit, undergarments, hydra-lite (pre work out), showers and lockers are available, a small area for your young children to hang out while you work out, and or a sitting area with a comfy sofa, a shower is also on site with change rooms. Studio is clean, light filled and airy. My Husband and i enjoyed our trial session today that we have decided to commit to it for the next few months, as a minimum! We Highly recommend this venue and the experience, Thanks G, we look forward to our next sesh!! 👊🏽
showerReviews.author: mj.

locations.title: Gold's Gym Fremantle

showerReviews.reviewText: Hey guys, I have been going to this gym even before it became Golds, the new owners accepted my original contract and did not increase my life membership fees. I see bad reviews and realize that its probably the ones that wont bring a towel, bring friends into the gym when the staff are not there, wont use some deodorant, or drop weights to gain attention, so in other words people with no respect that we don't want in the gym. My only issue is the time wasters, that sit on equipment checking their phones and doing nothing for 10 - 15 minutes at a time, they are the ones that should train or get out. BJ, if you need to sort out the pigeon issue, try the Bird Stop Spikes from Bunnings.
showerReviews.author: Graham Mackenzie

showerReviews.reviewText: South Beach Recreation Reserve in Fremantle is a gem along the coastline, offering a perfect blend of natural beauty and recreational activities. With its soft sandy shores and crystal-clear waters, it's an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, or simply enjoying a leisurely stroll along the beach. The reserve's well-maintained grassy areas are perfect for picnics and family gatherings, with plenty of shaded areas and barbecue facilities available. Additionally, the playgrounds provide endless entertainment for children, while the coastal walking paths offer stunning views of the Indian Ocean. South Beach Recreation Reserve is not just a place to relax; it's a vibrant hub of activity, with events, markets, and festivals happening throughout the year. Whether you're a local looking for a tranquil escape or a visitor wanting to experience the best of Fremantle's coastal charm, South Beach Recreation Reserve has something for everyone.
showerReviews.author: Haidelyn Mejica

Lovely lil friendly area with a great view & delicious food truck (the pickled octopus) for a fresh n tasty before or after swim bite 😍 Grassed area has shade, couple of picnic tables and benches so plenty of spots to sit.

Reasonable parking available close by to the rinse showers/tap so your dog doesn't stink out the car either! Wish I'd come here earlier!

Beautiful place to watch the sunset too!

locations.title: South Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
South Beach is one of the best spots in Perth for a relaxed day by the ocean. The beach itself is clean, spacious, and perfect for both families and individuals looking to unwind. The water is usually calm and clear, making it ideal for a refreshing swim, and the views of Fremantle and the marina add a really nice backdrop.

What really stands out here is how well set up the area is. There are plenty of shaded grassy areas with BBQs, picnic tables, and playgrounds, so it’s easy to spend an entire afternoon without needing to leave. The walking paths along the beach are great for a casual stroll or bike ride, and it’s also very dog-friendly — seeing happy dogs running along the sand adds to the atmosphere.

The facilities are excellent compared to many other beaches: you’ve got change rooms, showers, and a nearby café if you feel like grabbing a coffee or bite to eat. Parking is usually manageable, and the whole area feels safe and welcoming. Sunsets here are incredible too — the sky lights up over the water and it’s a perfect way to end the day.
showerReviews.author: maz z

locations.title: Freo Lodge

showerReviews.reviewText:
The good:
The beds are super comfy and lift up to provide more storage.
The fish and chips place across the street is really good.
It's a 10 minute walk to a number of cafes and a 25 minute walk to the center of town.
It's a really quiet place where you can relax

The bad:

Security is a problem because the front door doesn't lock automatically when you close it and, as a result, it's left open. The kitchen is detached and is open to the public. The door between the hostel and the kitchen is always unlocked. Anyone off the street can wander into the hostel. One of the lockers in my room was broken and couldn't be locked.

During my stay, one of the guests in my room appeared to be on drugs. They finally asked him to leave after a woman complained that he was making her uncomfortable. I'm concerned that they're not adequately screening guests to ensure the safety of everyone staying there.

I made a reservation for 4 days but the owner sent a message telling me to pay $385 by PayID. Four nights is about $200, so she charged me for a whole week.  I'm not an Australian resident, so I don't have PayID and had never even heard of it.

The shower floor is very slippery which creates a risk of injury from slipping and falling. The owner knows this but hasn't done anything about it.

There's no laundry for guests. The nearest Laundromat is a 15 minute walk.

In short, there are numerous unresolved issues concerning safety, security, and communication.  If these were addressed adequately, I'd recommend the place. Until then, I'm quite hesitant to recommend it.
showerReviews.author: carl gregory

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place used to be a boarding house for drug addicts and people who had just gotten out of prison (I found out after booking). It's had a lick of paint in places but it's still really grimy and for me, didn't feel safe so I moved elsewhere. When I checked at 2.30pm in there was someone passed out on a bed in a dark room full of junk. The carpets and shared spaces weren't clean (especially the shared bathroom which had dirty towels on the floor).

Also the room locks aren't secure (they add the room number to the universal code to the front door so anyone staying there could work out how to enter your room). I strongly recommend not staying here, especially if you are a solo female.

The woman I spoke with was very defensive when issues were raised.
showerReviews.author: Jesse Dean

locations.title: Fremantle Bed & Breakfast

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fremantle Bed & Breakfast is, as the name suggests, a B&B. While I typically stay in hotels, my father favored B&Bs overseas years ago, so I booked a two-night stay alone as a personal challenge. The slightly lower cost of a B&B is certainly easy on the wallet.

The building itself has character, but this means it is old and lacks modern features like a lift. Access to the rooms (Level 1 and above) is only via stairs, beginning right from the entrance. Prospective guests should be aware of this, as managing luggage is a key consideration. I would not recommend this accommodation for anyone with limited physical strength.

The breakfast offered is excellent, with options available for those requiring vegan or gluten-free meals. Since I have a small appetite, I declined some items, but the experience of sharing a meal with other travelers and having a pleasant conversation with the host was a fresh and enjoyable change.

A highly valuable service on the final day was the luggage storage. I was able to leave my bags and collect them later at my convenience.

Since B&Bs often feature shared toilet and shower facilities, it is crucial to be fully aware of who can use which facilities. Guests should not hesitate to confirm details if they are unsure.

Overall, it was a good two-night, three-day experience. A key positive note: the other guests were mostly older couples and were not loud. This was important to me, as I was concerned about potential noise issues.
showerReviews.author: Yoichi Satake (Yoh)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fremantle Bed & Breakfast is, as the name suggests, a B&B. While I typically stay in hotels, my father favored B&Bs overseas years ago, so I booked a two-night stay alone as a personal challenge. The slightly lower cost of a B&B is certainly easy on the wallet.

The building itself has character, but this means it is old and lacks modern features like a lift. Access to the rooms (Level 1 and above) is only via stairs, beginning right from the entrance. Prospective guests should be aware of this, as managing luggage is a key consideration. I would not recommend this accommodation for anyone with limited physical strength.

The breakfast offered is excellent, with options available for those requiring vegan or gluten-free meals. Since I have a small appetite, I declined some items, but the experience of sharing a meal with other travelers and having a pleasant conversation with the host was a fresh and enjoyable change.

A highly valuable service on the final day was the luggage storage. I was able to leave my bags and collect them later at my convenience.

Since B&Bs often feature shared toilet and shower facilities, it is crucial to be fully aware of who can use which facilities. Guests should not hesitate to confirm details if they are unsure.

Overall, it was a good two-night, three-day experience. A key positive note: the other guests were mostly older couples and were not loud. This was important to me, as I was concerned about potential noise issues.
showerReviews.author: Yoichi Satake (Yoh)

locations.title: St Patrick's Community Support Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Friendly and helpful to those in need. Free breakfast 7.30 - 8.30, with tea and coffee. Live music and anyone can sing along 2 mornins a week. Hot lunch $2.00 @ 11.30. Free showers, towels,shampoo, underwear, socks provided.
Free hairdresser once/ fortnight. Nurse on premises every day. Medical, Dental, Physio , Chiropractor also Counseling, and financial services .Food hampers for people in real need. Also free bread, fruit, vegies, tinned food as donated. Emergency accommodation. And more. Not government funded I don't think but funded by donations

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Community Centre is litetally the social, medical, legal and relief centre of Fremantle's battler community who were recently praised by the former head of the Reserve Bank of Australia for just being The Structurally Poor our economy depend upon to be (ummm) poor.

Run by The Order of St Patrick the centre caters to any one with a healthcare card. They can help with food, crisis accommodation, medical the list goes on. There's free breakfast and lunch at the centre there's showers and a mobile laundrette two mornings a week. There's also the street doctor.

The staff are fantastic.

Come in any time between 7:30 am and 2:30 pm and see for yourself.
showerReviews.author: Perry Dowd

locations.title: Anytime Fitness O'Connor

showerReviews.reviewText: Revo fitness costs you $42/month with no sort of commitment whatsoever with 24/7 access, but Anytime Fitness costs you $70-$95/month with lock in contract and restrictions/limitations around how often you can freeze your membership and if you go beyond the limit, you have to even pay for freezing your membership up. Staff are usually great but vary heaps in terms of obeying the guidelines of the gym and with all the extra money they take, they don’t even have extra towels for members who have forgotten to bring theirs! I used to be a member here just because their website doesn’t state anything about membership costs and contract restrictions so I got tricked at a young age but regret it out of my mind and won’t ever again consider it due to its lack of convenience.
showerReviews.author: mohammad nima nafisi

locations.title: The Neighbourhood Sauna - South Terrace

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful new space – even better experience!
I recently visited the new location of this spa and sauna spot (just further up the same street) — and it’s absolutely stunning. The space is so stylish, calming, and beautifully designed. You feel relaxed the moment you walk in 🧘🏻‍♀️

I had an infrared sauna session with a friend and it was amazing — super cozy, private, and comfortable. The health benefits of infrared are a huge bonus, but honestly, the experience itself was enough to leave us feeling refreshed and reset 🧖🏻‍♀️

The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. They even let me have a shower afterwards, and the facilities are fully stocked — shampoo, conditioner, towels, the works.

Highly recommend checking out the new space if you haven’t already. It’s a little sanctuary in the middle of the day ✨
showerReviews.author: Beatrice Marelli

showerReviews.reviewText:
I love this place! The atmosphere is so beautiful, love the complimentary tea, chocolate, aromatherapy, hydralyte water , tarot and oracles and the comfy couches! It’s so so affordable for the experience and I will definitely be returning regularly! I only wish the customer service was slightly more attentive, in my three times visiting there always seems to be at least one small thing forgotten, the first visit we weren’t informed that a shower was available, we were asked if we had any questions so I asked one and before I could ask anymore the person left very quickly. In my following visits some small things that bothered me were:
- not asking if we wanted towels
- not offering the music speaker, and then after I asked not making sure the speaker is charged or that I am able to successfully pair my phone with it.

Overall I have really enjoyed myself at this place, the staff are really lovely and I feel so grateful to have discovered this place! These are just some small things that would help push this already amazingly rejuvenating experience over the edge :)
showerReviews.author: Monti Brandolini

locations.title: Mandurah Aquatic And Recreation Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very modern and state of the art complex, still under going renovations.
Showers and toilet facilities are very clean and tidy.
Well priced membership options and the centre has everything you need with numerous pools to choose from depending on what you want to do.
Squash courts / Gymnasium & plenty of basketball courts also to choose from.
All in all a world class facility with friendly staff.

On the downside, the cafe is very small, you wouldnt want to be there on a really busy day or you might be waiting half the day to get a coffee or something to eat. Perhaps when the renovations are completed they might upgrade the cafe to something a little more substantial.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We joined PAQ Swimming Club in January after moving from QLD and were a bit nervous, especially for our oldest daughter who has been swimming competitively for four years and was attached to her club back in qld. From day one, we felt so welcome! Head Coach Renan quickly built a trusting relationship with our children, and his international experience really shows.
Junior Coach Alex has been fantastic with our younger son, making swimming fun and engaging.
Our kids love swimming even more than before, and the results are already showing. We couldn’t be happier!

locations.title: Kirby Swim Mandurah

showerReviews.reviewText: Both my kids attend Kirby Swim. Can't talk highly enough of Pritti, she is a fantastic teacher. She has so much patience, very nurturing and just all round is an amazing swimming teacher. Her teaching makes me as a Mum feel confident to leave my child with, she has great communication and is very adaptable to her students. We struggled early on with my daughter and her confidence as well as getting upset most lessons when she hit the age where she swam without a parent. Pritti consistently showed patience with her, reassurance and now has my daughter's full confidence in the pool and my daughter absolutely loves her. My son now has Pritti as a teacher. Overall the teachers and reception are so lovely, can't recommend this swimming school enough.
showerReviews.author: Sarah T Soltwisch

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been travelling 45 minutes to Kirby for two years now with my son. He started at 6weeks old with Leanne. I tried my local swimming pool for one term thinking the convenience of being closer might have been better. But, I quickly found the small class sizes, great teacher, warmer baby pool, cleaner facilities suited to baby swimmers and beautiful atmosphere at Kirby to be so worth the drive! I also love the consistency of not having to break over school holidays.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The beach area is spacious and family friendly: a broad flat beach leading onto a shallow swimming area. Perfect for families with toddlers.
The ablution facilities are close by and quite clean. Parking is adequate and abuts onto a play area for the children.
My only criticism was that the beach was littered with sea grasses that had obviously not been cleared in the past four weeks. Simply not good enough for the height of the holiday season.

showerReviews.reviewText:
i am a big beach person. particularly in the water.

yes, the beach has a very nice selection of facilities (e.g., shower, clean-ish bathrooms, etc.), but the beach face itself (in the water) is covered in sharp rocks.

if you want to experience having fear of walking anywhere along the water for the thought of stubbing your toe on a sharp rock, this would be the perfect experience for you. personally left the beach with multiple cuts and bruises all over my feet.

if im swimming, i wont be coming back here.
showerReviews.author: spon

locations.title: Town Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: Town Beach, Mandurah is one of the best beaches in Perth - North and North-West facing it is protected from the sea breeze and hence calmer than most WA beaches. Long breaks also provide good water sports activities at certain times. It’s marked off from boats too so good for swimming. The sand is restocked each winter by the cross channel dredging that occurs south of the river. Excellent cafes, bars and restaurants nearby plus the famous infinity pool at the Seashells Hotel overlook this beach. Dog beach just to the north too. Plenty of parking to both sides as well. 10 out of 10
showerReviews.author: Andrew Peatling

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed at the powered camp sites. What an amazing site! Located in between the beach and estuary. Very friendly service! The toilet/shower rooms are absolutely sparkling clean. Probably the best toilet we have ever been compare to other caravan park. Kitchen is huge and full with cooking wares. showerReviews.reviewText:
Our group of 19 (12 adults, 5 children, and 2 dogs) had a truly enjoyable 3-night stay over the recent long weekend.

The caravan park offers a variety of accommodation options, including camping sites and a mix of older and new modern chalets. Also available for residents to use are communal bathrooms and showers, and a large kitchen and dining area with appliances, cookware, and cutlery. There is swimming pool as well.

We stayed in a superior 4-bed chalet, which was quite new and beautifully furnished. The bedding was high quality, the sofa and TV comfortable, and the kitchen well-equipped with high quality modern appliances. The bathroom was spotless and of excellent standard. Definitely 5-star quality! We also appreciated having an undercover parking spot right at our chalet’s entrance.

The location is ideal — about 20 minutes drive from Mandurah, an hour from Perth, and around 2 hours from Margaret River. It’s also conveniently close to local amenities: a 2-minute walk to an IGA, Celebrations liquor store, Thai restaurant, and a medical centre, with Coles less than a kilometre away. The beautiful Dawesville foreshore is a leisurely 7 minutes walk.

Check-in was smooth and hassle-free, with friendly and welcoming staff. The overall vibe from both reception and residents was warm and inviting.

We’ll definitely be returning!
showerReviews.author: Jaipreet Singh

locations.title: Estuary Hideaway Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText: Family friendly camp site. If you want for a quick relaxing get away, then this is a place to be. Very relaxing ambiance. Well maintained, friendly staffs, clean, has the essentials that you need. Common room for cooking and dinner are well maintained. Barbecue spots are clean. The kids enjoyed the playground, tennis court, basketball court and pool. If you don't have fridge for camping, there is also fridge in the kitchen. Showers have warm water too though the taps are leaking
showerReviews.author: A A

showerReviews.reviewText:
Right, so, its a camp site with rooms for camper vans/trailers.... not really "rooms" when you bring your own. But the room we brought with us was freakin' ace, baby! And there were plenty of other people's rooms to take a gander at to check where ours was on the ladder and which options might appeal next time we upgrade 😉

It's a tidy bunch of camp sites right next to the water with ablution blocks, reasonable shared kitchen options and some picnic tables/gazebos sprinked though the park if you need to expand. We had a couple families in our group and a wide age range of kids in tow. Young ones had a ball investigating all the secret spots and the old ones had just enough signal to remain stationery but not enough to completely ignore the surroundings (lots of buffering time). I think that's a feature!

Occasional mozzie clouds, an on-site shop of sorts, and entertainment on the first two nights we were there with (paid) BBQ and coffee van were such a great option when we CNBFed cooking. It was pretty cool, actually.

Some glampers might not be thrilled with the borewater amenities and general mineralisation present in a lot of fixtures, but perhaps they could take themselves off to Bunnings for a bag of cement....

Good, old fashion, Mandurian holiday spot down the estuary. Feel the serenity!
showerReviews.author: Ben Davis

showerReviews.reviewText:
!!!!Just be careful here!!! Booked in for 3 nights. Receptionist was pleasant but handed me the EFTPOS machine and asked for payment. I informed her I already paid via Hipcamp. She then realised and muttered something along the lines that they haven't been paid from them yet.

She gave me the map and instructions, the entry was congested with caravans as they have a drop chain barrier, but no place to park your caravan whilst you book in. Chaos!

Anyway, drove in looked at our unpowered site, absolutely disgraceful it was atrocious. No barrier or fence from the 100kms an hour road main road next to it, bore water, hideous camp kitchen, no phone reception and blow flys everywhere. It's this tiny uneven sand pit with trees and leaves all around. Went back to reception informed the receptionist we were not staying. The look on her face was classic, she was genuinely surprised lol. I mean it's so bad it's laughable. Sorry it's a big NO from me... Good Luck.
showerReviews.author: Christian

locations.title: The Sebel Mandurah

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived, the welcoming reception was a fantastic start to our holiday. The staff were so friendly, helpful, and genuinely warm, making the check-in process smooth and instantly setting a relaxed tone for our stay.
Our apartment was the definition of comfortable luxury. It was spacious, and provided all the amenities we could possibly need—truly a home away from home. Every detail felt considered, which contributed greatly to our comfort.
A special mention must go to the bed, which was incredibly comfy and made for an excellent night's sleep after a full day of exploring Mandurah. The entire room was so inviting, clean, and beautifully presented.
The hotel boasts a picturesque location. It was wonderfully convenient to simply stroll along the boardwalk and easily find a restaurant for dinner each night.
Thank you to the entire team for providing such a high standard of service and accommodation. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with you and will certainly be recommending The Sebel Mandurah to friends and family.
showerReviews.author: Kim Mogensen

locations.title: GLAMPING MANDURAH

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely amazing spot to stay at in Mandurah. Owner is incredibly kind and generous and gave us a great deal when our camper van was getting work done across the road. The tent is super cozy and warms up well with heaters and electric blankets, and a whole collection of dvd’s to watch. Outdoor shower and bathtub are lovely and clean and there’s lots of privacy. The Spudshed nearby had great prices on groceries to take back to the camp and there’s lots of kitchen supplies provided to cook yourself wonderful meals. Couldn’t recommend this place enough, I only wish we were able to stay longer!
showerReviews.author: Ashlin Hamlin

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and I stayed here over aussie day weekend. It's so close to serpentine river close to shops and bottleo for last minute things.
The place is cozy and tidy with a fully equipped outdoor kitchen mini fridge and fairy lights to guide your way in the dark to the tent which had 3 comfortable beds board games ring toss and a large variety of movies to snuggle down with. The bbq area is lovely and the outdoor bathroom is divine with a stone tub and outdoor shower. Another shower inside the ex rain water tank with toilet and sink. There's also a hairdryer for convenience.

The owners gave very detailed directions which made it a breeze to find the place and the exact location of the tent. Heating and cooling available in the glamping tent which was an absolute must over the hot humid weekend.

Over all it's absolutely stunning and fabulous location and would definitely book again.
showerReviews.author: Caitlin Bell

showerReviews.reviewText: Honestly, my experience with the staff at this campsite was disgusting. The woman caretaker ( looks a little rough around the edges ) was beyond rude and aggressive. She slammed the door in our faces at reception and wouldn't even let us speak! When she approached us she came at us totally unreasonable. We couldn’t talk or even ask for an explanation without being abruptly cut off. They definitely have a cockroach infestation, and if you dont like showering with moths, please dont come here. The cleaning lady was super unfriendly, no manners whatsoever, not even a smile. It feels like the owner doesn’t care about all these bad reviews. Can’t even have the kids play around for a bit without a complaint. If they can't handle a few kids enjoying themselves during the day and having some innocent fun. They should just say no kids allowed!! Seriously, do not bring your kids here, the caretaker has made it pretty obvious that they are not welcomed, even sitting around the table and giggling is too much for them. The park is completely filled with creepy and unwelcoming residents. Save yourself the trouble and find a better place!
showerReviews.author: Amalia Medeiros Silva

locations.title: Jarrah Forest Lodge

showerReviews.reviewText:
We spent the weekend here in a cadet room for a mountain biking weekend and it was great. The room was basic but that was reflected in the price, the bathrooms and showers were clean and modern. Stephanie was very helpful and friendly when I made my booking and provided some great local knowledge.

Only negatives were the bathroom door closer causes it to slam, and there was a group of heavy drinkers that slammed that door every 20 minutes until 2 am. Although for the price, I couldn't expect an aircon in each room, but maybe a decent ceiling fan would be nice. Minor issues only, I would stay there again.
showerReviews.author: Joe R

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely, well-kept, classic lodge experience that is sadly disappearing. I stayed at the 'cadet' solo accommodation on a trip through on the Bibbulmun. Though self-service, the staff I did deal with were pleasant, the accommodation was quaint, clean, and the facilities (shared laundry and toilets/showers) were immaculate. Just a quick walk from the town centre, located in beautiful bushland, it was a great place to recuperate for a couple days. I will definitely be back.
showerReviews.author: Joel McGarvey

showerReviews.reviewText: Awesome place to take a break without driving for hours from Perth. The location is superb as a base to go mountain biking from. The pizza oven was fantastic but if you plan to make pizzas remember it does require preheating a number of hours before you plan to use it. The fire pit is great to sit around and radiates heat on a cold night. Most accommodation does not have cooking facilities we stayed in the forest lodge which had rudimentary facilities but the communal kitchen is well appointed. None of the rooms are en-suite all showers and toilets are shared this being the primary reason for me not giving five stars.
showerReviews.author: David Stanbridge

showerReviews.reviewText:
The size of the room was very small. This property is ideally suitable if you do not intend to do anything except shower and sleep. Alterations had been made to make it user friendly, i.e. a wardrobe. However it had been cut into the ceiling trim but not finished off. The window blind had to be left closed as the window just faced into the buildings service atrium, pipes are not a great view.
The bed linen was good quality but the white comforter cover had stains on it. The towels were not such good quality but workable.
Generally it was clean but empty beer bottles from the previous client were sitting beside the refrigerator. Doesn't give confidence that cleaning is a high standard. Pity...

locations.title: Foreshore Motel

showerReviews.reviewText:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ A Fantastic Stay – The Best Yet!

I’ve stayed at the Foreshore Motel many times over the years, but my stay this week has been the absolute best. I booked a couple of nights for last weekend through Booking.com, and the moment I walked into reception I could immediately see the improvements. The reception area has been refreshed with new paint, is ultra clean, and I was greeted with a wonderfully warm welcome by the lovely lady at the desk.

My accommodation room has had a huge makeover as well — fresh paint, new carpet, a sparkling clean bathroom, and brand-new bedding. It looks completely different from before, when it felt a bit old and tired. My friends staying in the room next door were just as happy, even commenting that their room looked and smelt brand new.

The swimming pool area also looks refreshed, like it’s had its own makeover, which was great to see.

The location is one of the things I’ve always loved about this motel. It’s right in the centre of town, less than a minute’s walk to the foreshore and surrounded by restaurants, bars, and shops. It’s also incredibly convenient for public transport, with a bus stop right outside the motel that takes you directly to the train station. One morning we hopped on a train and headed into Perth for the day — super easy.

Overall, this was my best stay at the motel yet. The upgrades are impressive, the service was warm and welcoming, and the location remains unbeatable. I’ll definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Natalie Dillon

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cannot beat the price for its location. It's just walking distance to Mandurah Terrace, where there are lots of restaurants, parks and events.

It's good enough for a 1-2 nights stay where you can sleep in after wandering about.

While it's a 3-star hotel/motel, I think this place can do with a little more upgrade to their furnitures like the bed, chairs and the fridge. We noticed the fridge leaking air which could cost more in electricity. The bed is not in the best condition so if you have sensitive back, this might not be for you.

The sink also in the bathroom, too small to do anything aside from wash hands maybe. Aside from that and water will be all over the floor. I hope they can get a bigger one as there's enough space. However the bathroom itself is clean and we appreciated that.

The curtain also didn't cover the whole window properly; if someone thinks about it they can definitely see most of inside the room. We had to use the ironing board to keep the curtain in place to ensure we're safe.

On the plus side, we liked how they gave free shampoos, conditioners, soap and coffee. There's also a jug of water in the fridge, a kettle, a small microwave, and a TV.
showerReviews.author: Chloe

showerReviews.reviewText: I highly recommend Mandurah Swimming Club for swimmers of all abilities. My 9 and 12-year-olds have progressed from swimming for fitness to competitive swimming in their first season with the club, under the guidance of their coaches, Sharky and Mike. It is a very friendly, well organised, supportive and educational club where newcomers are welcomed like family. My children have benefited not only from instruction in the pool, but have also undertaken dry land exercises and mindset coaching, increasing their confidence and resilience as a result. I believe my children have discovered what will be a lifelong passion for swimming due to the inclusiveness of Mandurah Swimming Club - thanks guys!

locations.title: Lai Thai Massage and Spa Mandurah

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been going here for 4 months almost regularly, I’ve had a mix of relaxation and deep tissue. I have never given 5 stars to any review, I will come back and change it if I feel I need too.

Personally I have been getting massages for 12 years, everywhere I go (including overseas) and this massage parlour is hands down the best I have been too for regular massages.

Consistency: 10/10
I’ve had 6 different therapists and every massage is almost identical to each other. I know what I’m getting every time.

Quality: 10/10
The change in pressure from relaxation to deep tissue is not only consistent throughout the therapists but they do not change pressure throughout the massage. (Besides deep tissue of course)
They also give PROPER Thai massage. Wash the feet before and be prepared for the slight contortion stretching

Pricing: 9/10
Still highly competitive prices but incredible value for money, it’s only a 9 because who wouldn’t love everything to be cheaper

Facilities and amenities: 10/10
Comfy beds and waiting room. Soft towels, beds and face pillow. The best face pillows I’ve laid my head on

Professionally: 10/10
They are all really nice and sweet. They are quick to get you in and will try and fit you in if there’s wriggle room. You always get a snack and tea or water afterwards, highly recommend the tea.
showerReviews.author: Amelia Smith

locations.title: Waterlily Brow & Beauty Studio

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was gifted a float session at Waterlily Beauty & Brow and was really looking forward to a relaxing experience. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed by both the hygiene standards and how a situation was handled afterwards.

Upon entering the room, I noticed the shower was not clean and lacked basic amenities like shampoo and conditioner. I also pointed out a used tampon in the shower to the staff — something that should never happen in a spa setting.

To my surprise, I later received a message implying that I had left the item behind and was menstruating during the float — which I was not. The tone of the message felt accusatory and inappropriate, especially considering I was the one who raised the hygiene concerns in the first place. It also referenced a $1500 fee, which felt unnecessarily intimidating given the circumstances.

While I understand the importance of cleanliness and respecting policies, I believe this could have been handled with more professionalism and care. It left me feeling uncomfortable and judged, rather than relaxed and cared for — which is what a wellness experience should offer.

I hope the business takes this feedback on board to improve both their hygiene standards and how sensitive issues are addressed with clients.
showerReviews.author: Liz O

locations.title: Dolphin Discovery Centre Bunbury
locations.address: Anchorage Cove off, Koombana Dr, Bunbury WA 6230

showerReviews.reviewText: The swimming with dolphins was awesome! We spent quite a long time with the dolphins in the water. Our guide Kim and the volunteers were great and really took care of the dolphins. As they are wild animals we were rather waiting for them to approach us, than swimming towards them. For our group that worked out perfectly, the dolphins came to us, circled us several times and swam right besides and beneath us. Great experience and highly recommendable.
showerReviews.author: Florian Huber

showerReviews.reviewText: The swimming with dolphins was awesome! We spent quite a long time with the dolphins in the water. showerReviews.author: Florian Huber

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a group of 5, we decided to do a day trip to the DDC today being a Thurs to wrap up the school holiday. Drove 2 hours down, got there around 10.30am, 2-3 groups waiting in line for entry. We made it to get a glimpse of a dolphin fin half way down to the interaction zone, then came back for feeding time inside the centre.
The marine discovery centre wasn’t big but had enough to offer for an hour or so. Younger children could spend longer in there. They also have a scanner for kids’ colourings to be scanned and projected onto the screens.
We then went on the train ride for $35 for all 5 of us before coming back to spend a bit more time at the interaction zone but no dolphin showed up again.
Most staff members were friendly and helpful. The toilets there in DDC have warm showers which was very helpful.
There is this big playground next to DDC, with flying fox and suspended rope bridge.
We will come back again if we are in the area again, and will bring the kids back to swim with the dolphins when kids are more grown up.
The only thing to mention is that the website is a bit confusing in main entry vs feeding time tickets.  It looked to me that we would have to get separate passes for entry and feeding times.
All in all we had a good day.
showerReviews.author: Antonia W

showerReviews.reviewText:
We are considering lucky to be there at the right time. On Internet people were saying about 9am. So we are early that day, found a nice parking spot with our motorhome, then stroll the beach at about 7+ in the morning.

And we are surprised to see an early bird! I can't rmb her name, that was mentioned but they said its an rare site for early sighting.

And after about 15mins, the dolphin swam away, and we went back our motorhome for breakfast. Till about 9am+ we start to see commotion, then we went back to the shoreline where the centre was, and yes we saw her again.

First of all, all these experience is free, so don't worry about it. Only those going for swimming with dolphin then you need to pay,which is organised by them.

Secondly, the dolphins will swim quite close to you,depending on your luck. As they swam beside us really very close like a hand reach away, while we are knee deep in seawater.

Lastly! I would like to thank all the crew from DOLPHIN DISCOVERY CENTRE, for constantly looking out for dolphin and so caring these wild dolphin, which benefit us public and also these dolphin eco life!

So hopefully you all are also as lucky as us when you are there (:
showerReviews.author: Kai Xiang Lim

showerReviews.author: Jonathon Brisbane

showerReviews.reviewText: Heaps of free parking, well maintained amenities and heated little kids pool. All pools are indoors
showerReviews.author: Jonathon Brisbane

showerReviews.reviewText: So - after planning a couple of day stay in Australind with my daughter -we decided to go one arvo for a swim. All the holiday sites and main front page of the LLLC site did not prepare me for the kids pool to be closed and a tonne of signs to have taken over the indoor area. With no reduced entry fee - my daughter and I went in. (I have since noticed that in their - what’s on section - is where they notify customers the pools are out of action. How about making it a bit more visible on the front web page ?)  I was in shock the minute we walked into the pool area with only about 4 people swimming (3pm Tuesday). Firstly - we went into the family change room to put our bathers on- and yuck the dirty water sitting in there was so gross. But we changed and went out.  Secondly - the mould around the base of the kids pool - where we left our bags so we could go in the big pool was a big turn off. The pool did not seem to be heated to what I have read it should be ? So I stood in the pool at waist height for about 60-90 mins whilst my 7yo splashed about. Thirdly - We then hopped out - and thought yuck about the family change room so walked into female change area where the teen girls who were previously swimming were scrubbing the tiled floor with soap and using a towel to dry and clean up an area so they could change - I said / oh this is as gross as the other area - but worse as what a turn off that customers were having to clean up the filthy areas - change rooms where we expect to feel fresh and clean. So we went to the family change again - I too had spare towels and put them down on the ground where it was dry near the door, (I did not scrub the floor though ) we left our thongs on and continued to have Luke warm water showers - it was disgusting. I just couldn’t believe we’d paid to get in to use such sub par facilities. Please please please consider keeping these areas super clean - if only to make up for the sub par facilities available.
showerReviews.author: Dia Sargeant

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice staff, but annoyed at the steam room. Like why pay extra when the steam room is cold?

Have asked a couple of times and they say they set it to a temp and don't wanna change it, but like it's cold?

Today I just sat for an hour in the bathroom next to it and turned the hot water on, it actually was way steamier than the "Steam room"
Please change it, I know you wanna make it so it's not to hot for people who can't handle it, but its to cold.
A steam room is supposed to be hot otherwise why is it there?

locations.title: Bunbury Glade Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love Bunbury Glades Caravan Park. It's one of the cheapest in the area. It includes powered and unpowered sites - on cement and grass, large pool, water hookup, camp kitchens, cabins, toilets, showers, laundry, recreation room with pool table and playground.

There's even wildlife on-site like western ringtail possums, ibises and 2 families of ducks.

Across the road from the Salvos Humble Jumble Thrift Store, minutes from the shopping centre, beach and Bunbury Wildlife Park.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love Bunbury Glades Caravan Park. It's one of the cheapest in the area. It includes powered and unpowered sites - on cement and grass, large pool, water hookup, camp kitchens, cabins, toilets, showers, laundry, recreation room with pool table and playground.

There's even wildlife on-site like western ringtail possums, ibises and 2 families of ducks.

Across the road from the Salvos Humble Jumble Thrift Store, minutes from the shopping centre, beach and Bunbury Wildlife Park.
showerReviews.author: Melissa Plater

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here for 2 nights in an RV to attend the AFL North v Eagles game. The caravan park was an easy walk to the ground, facilities were clean, multiple toilets, shower and wash facilities.

Loads of rubbish bins around the site, good tree coverage, power, water and grey water connections for our powered site. Also an easy 10-15 minutes walk south from here is a shopping centre where you can pick up any supplies you may need.
showerReviews.author: Elroo

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Bunbury Village

showerReviews.reviewText:
It was okay. It seems set up brilliantly for campers and caravans, but not for people in cabins.

I think a $10 Kmart clothes airer would go a long way in the cabins though. There was nowhere to hang our wet towels and bathers. There are also no pegs near the clotheslines so for towels it's okay but for baby outfits it was impossible to hang anything we washed or that was wet.

Also we hated that the sprinklers were on in the afternoon on the main lawn. It meant our kids couldn't play on the lawn in the afternoon as it was wet. Also as it was windy the sprinklers were blowing into our already impossible-to-dry laundry.

The pool was nice. The place felt super empty though despite there being no cabins left to book online. There are a lot of permanent caravans and cabins there so we kind  of felt like strangers in a tight knit community. All the people we met were lovely though.

Would suit families with older kids as the room upstairs in the cabin has no door, so our 4 year old kept coming down and wanted to hang with us while we were watching tv.
showerReviews.author: PJ Van der weyde

showerReviews.reviewText:
Accomodation was basic, which was fine. Staff was incredibly rude. A lady came and asked me to move my car from our accommodation and both my partner and I drove down separately. As I was about to move my car a man came into our room drilling me with 20 questions as to who was staying there then said and I quote “your lying to me” If he had given me the chance to explain he would have heard that u was only staying the 1 night instead of 3 as my dog was having surgery and that is why we came down in 2 cars!
Over priced for run down amenities. Great location but would not return.
showerReviews.author: Fallon Beckingham

showerReviews.reviewText: This was greatly located and a quiet and friendly place. I stayed here for approximately 2months using various types of accommodation they had available. The management staff and other guests did as much as they could to welcome me to the area. It's always getting booked out so be sure to book ahead. Rooms are well equipped aswell as the on-site camp kitchen equipped with everything anyone could want to use to cook any meal. Great pub next to it and not for to shops. Prices are also competitive with the rest of the area. Overall impressive and was sad to leave

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here over the week after Xmas with my family. In total 4 rooms. 2 of us got charged twice. The room I had was ok but the view was of a bunch of steel and building material.
I was told to park my boat in a spot where I did.
The next day I was showering and some guy came and asked my son who was staying in the room and how many people were staying very rude like. He then told him we are allowed to park the boat there. My partner came out and he told her she was a liar about how many people were staying in the accomodation and the boat had to move and Only  allowed one car. He was the guy with tattoos driving the buggy around. The park in general was very old and boring. One very small playground for kids. We will never go back very below average. The price we paid for what we got was unfathomable.
showerReviews.author: Rob Morrison

There are plenty of tables to sit at, the beach in front is not suitable for swimming as it has too many rocks.

Facilities provided include free parking, gas bbqs and also public toilets.
