showerReviews.reviewText:
Last Friday, one of my 4 bookings went and spoke to Ali.

Jonathan explained that he was part of our booking and was changing rooms and the 4th booking was not required.

When I was the last to book in. No one mentioned there was still a room available.

As Jonathan had taken care of it I didn't ask.

So for your staff to stick to the line that they were not aware he was part of our group is wrong.

Ask Ali!

He told her the room was not required.

She never took it up with me.

I only found out 3 days later?

If you were so desperate to sell the room. Why not call me and ask why?

Probably because Ali knew it wasn't required and was told the company needs extra profits?

Who knows,  however I will be expecting a full refund and apologise.

Hope they spend my money on a much needed renovation and Staff customers service training.
showerReviews.author: SPK

showerReviews.reviewText: The customer service was very good throughout my short stay for work but there were a few things very much below average, the restaurant and quality of breakfast was not great, the walls of the rooms are paper thin and so when my neighbours came home a little after 11 pm I could every word they spoke and their snoring throughout the night.  The bathrooms are not very well thought out, even a small space (of which the bathrooms are) could be set out much better, the towel could not be reached after using the sink unless the door was closed - I realise this seems trivial however I noticed it.

locations.title: THE LORD FORREST HOTEL
locations.address: s Premier Hotel Resort, Indoor Swimming Pool and Spa, City Location, 20 symmons 16-20 Symmons Street, Ocean Views, Bunbury WA 6230

showerReviews.reviewText:
Check-in was extremely slow due to their systems not working. While technical issues happen, the staff member handling our check-in was rude and unhelpful, making the system failure feel like it was somehow our problem rather than offering an apology or assistance.

The restaurant deserves credit — the food is genuinely amazing. Unfortunately, the service does not match the quality of the meals, which was disappointing.

The rooms are okay and fit for purpose but are extremely basic, old, and outdated. More concerning was the hot water, which ran yellow like rusted water — the hot water system clearly needs attention.

The biggest issue, however, was the environment. There were a number of undesirable guests staying at the hotel during our visit. I would absolutely not recommend bringing family here. There were people openly partying, multiple guests clearly under the influence of drugs, and one incident where a man on the top floor, shirtless, was yelling and screaming at people walking past — clearly drug affected. It felt unsafe and completely inappropriate for a family stay.

Given what we witnessed, I have contacted the Department of Health, as drug use (including smoking substances in rooms) poses a serious health risk to future guests.

I will not be staying here again in the foreseeable future, and I strongly recommend others — especially families — stay elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Ryan Stewart

showerReviews.reviewText: Decided to stay here for a cheeky getaway with the wife I booked the one bedroom apartment with spa and ocean views locatedon the top floor, The room was very nice and large in size, the views were amazing watching the sun set. Amenities included were good and the bathroom very nice the only downside was the air-conditioning was not good at all and I had to ask for a fan to sleep comfortably. The hotels restaurants are very nice and the breakfast was delicious and well worth the price. I highly recommend this hotel for everything but its air-conditioning
showerReviews.author: Shane Magee

showerReviews.reviewText:
While the rooms smell and appear to be renovated, this is the first hotel I have ever stayed in where I have come out in full body contact dermatitis. I don't know if it is bed bugs or just an irritant in the bed sheets. In case you were wondering if I am susceptible to reactions, I have never had a reaction like this.
The lighting in the bathroom is pretty awful, and the lack of a fan means that the mirror fogs up very quickly unless you leave the bathroom door wide open.
The design of the hotel is very strange. All the rooms open out into an open central area where the restaurant and pool are. What it means is that all the sounds echo throughout that central area and through the door of the hotel room. If you are looking for quiet, you will have to wait until the restaurant is done for the evening. And you will also be able to hear your neighbours shower when they are having one.
The buffet breakfast was the worst I have ever experienced. $30 for a very small selection and they didn't even have coffee included with that. On the day I tried it, there was only tea bags available and if you wanted coffee you would have to pay $5 extra for them to make an espresso coffee.
showerReviews.author: Scott Ripley

showerReviews.reviewText: One of the worst hotels I have stayed at for a very long time.   Breakfast is the only meal provided at the hotel on the weekend.  The bar and resturant is closed up until 5pm apparently.   However when we went for a drink on the Sunday it was shut.  The lighting in the room is very poor and you need curtains open all the time to get some light.  Bathroom has no fan.  Rooms are very tired.  Ocean view is average.  Wasn't cheap at $280 a night.  Pool is in a weird location.  Staff are lacking knowledge and takes forever for rooms to be made up.  If you wanted any type of room service forget it.  The book they have is very mis leading.  Overal a very disappointing experience.  The shower head was broken as well.  We won't ever book again.  I' have family here and was born in Bunbury.  Needs a lot of work to bring up to any type of standard. Very noisy place to stay as well
showerReviews.author: Ben

showerReviews.reviewText:
Binningup Beach Caravan Park offers a fantastic spot for a relaxing holiday right by the ocean. The park is clean, well-maintained, and has a great variety of sites to suit caravans, campervans, and tents.

What really sets it apart is the stunning beach just steps away—perfect for swimming, fishing, or simply soaking up the sun. The facilities, including clean amenities and communal areas, are well cared for and make your stay comfortable.

The staff are friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with any questions or local tips. It’s a peaceful, family-friendly environment that makes you want to come back again and again.

If you’re looking for an affordable, beautiful beachside caravan park in the area, Binningup Beach Caravan Park is a top choice.
showerReviews.author: Dilshan Gamage

locations.title: Lake Brockman Tourist Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Took the family for a Christmas camping trip and stayed at Lake Brockman on one of the unpowered camper trailer site and its pet friendly. Loved the location as we were in amongst the trees. Close to but not on top of the toilets and camp kitchen. Showers where pretty great for camp showers and the water was always perfect temperature. We even used the camp kitchen for our larger meal making and lived that we could store our extra fruit in the shared fridge.

The dam is beautiful, only down fall is I forgot my reef shoes and the ground is very rocky. The whole family enjoyed swimming and Kayaking. Would've been nicer if there was an exclusion zone close to camp for launching boats and jet skis as we had a few come alwfuly close to us. We got to cycle through the forest all the way to the bridge and that was so much fun.

Got a chance to grab a quick bite at the café and enjoyed the bacon egg roll and chips. Their little shop sells everything you could possibly forget to pack and more.

Great interaction with ground staff and café staff.

Will note there is no signal for none Telstra users (love that my kids where tech free 😀)

Will definitely be back
showerReviews.author: Chantelle Pero

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our Glamping weekend was perfect ⭐️
the glamping tent overlooking the lake with it’s own balcony and seating area around a campfire was spot on. The tent was lovely, clean and had all the amenities we needed. The staff were so kind and attentative as soon as they welcomed us at reception. There were only small negatives one being the rowdy noise levels from other campsite “residents” very late into the night which made it difficult to sleep which is no fault of the campsite (despite there being an after 10pm quiet time rule too). Also, the toilet block directly opposite is supposedly meant for glamping tent users only (with an access code) since there is only 2 toilets and 2 showers, it was a bit annoying having to share the block with other campsite users. There is little to do around the area so any more than a couple of days might feel too much for some people, but it was well needed rest and relaxation. Other than that, we thoroughly enjoyed our weekend/public holiday stay here at Lake Brockman and have already recommended it to friends and family. We think it was reasonably priced and good value.
showerReviews.author: Hannah Blair

locations.title: Peppermint Grove Beach Holiday Park
locations.address: 48 Peppermint Grove Rd, Peppermint Grove Beach WA 6271

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a perfect place to spend a not-nearly-enough 5 wonderful nights!!
It was crazy busy when we arrived, with ANZAC weekend & kids not yet at school.
When the weekend was over we almost had the park to ourselves & it was magical.
The gardens are well looked after as are the sites. Sprinklers running to freshen up the grassed areas.

The shower amenities, although very well  maintained, were very small, not nearly enough space to dry off & dress. My only hiccup.

The shop is well stocked, with everything from a cute little bottle shop, groceries to clothes & a licensed restaurant…

Peppermint Grove C/Park is perfectly situated in the middle of Busselton & Bunbury & close to other tourist places. The beach was picturesque & we had it to ourselves on a couple of occasions.

I loved this caravan park & highly recommend it.
showerReviews.author: Di H

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a perfect place to spend a not-nearly-enough 5 wonderful nights!!
It was crazy busy when we arrived, with ANZAC weekend & kids not yet at school.
When the weekend was over we almost had the park to ourselves & it was magical.
The gardens are well looked after as are the sites. Sprinklers running to freshen up the grassed areas.

The shower amenities, although very well  maintained, were very small, not nearly enough space to dry off & dress. My only hiccup.

The shop is well stocked, with everything from a cute little bottle shop, groceries to clothes & a licensed restaurant…

Peppermint Grove C/Park is perfectly situated in the middle of Busselton & Bunbury & close to other tourist places. The beach was picturesque & we had it to ourselves on a couple of occasions.

I loved this caravan park & highly recommend it.
showerReviews.author: Di H

showerReviews.reviewText: Hi we just spent the Labour Day long weekend here, great caravan park and amenities and good staff, we stayed in a on-site chalet, while they maybe a little small it was great for us as we were always outside enjoying the experience. The rooms consist of a shower, toilet and a queen bed and are super quiet, we slept in every morning as the rooms are dark and quiet you don’t hear any external noise, there is also a excellent camp kitchen with everything you need during your stay, we will be re booking again for next year..
showerReviews.author: John Western

locations.title: The Parade Hotel – Bar & Bistro

showerReviews.reviewText: We just spent 5 days here and loved it. Neat tidy clean rooms. Plenty of space for 2 adults Excellent water pressure and lovely hot showers in the morning. As an added bonus staying guests received 10% of all meals and drinks.er had all 5 diners here saved driving or walking into town and back and we got to watch the Lovely sunsets and see the full moon from the outdoor deck areas.. Lovely chatty happy staff . Amazing views on the outdoor decking and seating areas of the river and towards Bunbury main centre which was a leisurely 20 min walk along the river front through the parklands. Large selection of beers on tap and plenty of menu options for meals. The happy wife cafe was next door for hot and cold breakfast and your coffee in the morning with very friendly ladies to chat too at very reasonable prices. Quiet area hardly any noise about from the local wildlife. If ever in the area again would definitely stay again. An easy 45,min drive from Busselton airport. Bunbury lovely town for an extra long weekend.
showerReviews.author: Trevor Knyvett

locations.title: Geraldton Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently moved here from Tasmania and I fell in love with this beach straight away.🙂❤️
The waters are Crystal clear and the ocean is always calm but  already in the past 6 months I have had two separate encounters with dolphins 🐬 that have swam into the Cove hunting fish.
The experience was surreal as I have never been that close to such Majestic creatures.
The mother and baby fished and swam up and down the stretch of beach catching fish ,throwing these fish in the air and then stunning them as they hit them a few times by their tails.
They also did a circle motion to gather and divide these fish and would bang with their strong tails which seemed to confuse the fish then made a beline to the shore catching the many white little fish that were swimming that day.
One of the Greatest experiences ever and something I will never forget.
showerReviews.author: Nat Jane

locations.title: Geraldton Backpackers on the Foreshore

showerReviews.reviewText:
0% vibes, 100% rules. More like staying at a boarding school than a travellers hostel. Guests spoken to like children by the owner, be prepared for an inquisition and rules lecture on arrival. This is a pure money play venture and the atmosphere shows it. The old place may as well be haunted. Other than that, the beds are super comfy and clean, good amenities and location is great, secure parking, strictly no dogs allowed; even though my dog stayed in the car overnight I was told
to park in the street. You get the picture. Owner is nuts, shouted at me first thing in the morning again about my dog, that her dogs will “literally” be killed if they smell his wee. The only backpackers in town, unfortunately.
showerReviews.author: Martin Lawrence Douthwaite

locations.title: Geraldton Belair Gardens Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Thanks for a lovely stay Belair Gardens.
Check-in was easy and the receptionists were super helpful and customer focused - thank you, this sort of service is getting rare. We were on a site close to the amenities and laundry as requested which was appreciated.  The amenities block we were near are old but kept really clean. Our travel companions were in a cabin which was really lovely. The park is close to the beach and the magnificent lighthouse - on the walk we also saw a magnificent sea Eagle's nest with young.  It is also a short drive to Geraldton central and Geraldton's beautiful waterfront precinct.  We couldn't have wanted for much more. Thanks again.

NB Photos are of Geraldton and surrounds.
showerReviews.author: Janette McNair

showerReviews.reviewText: Firstly, I can't believe that one star review. They must have been staying somewhere else. I'm currently staying in our campervan at Belair caravan Park and it's lovely. Sheoak trees for shade, lots of space and the whole place is beautifully maintained. Staff are super friendly and helpful. This place has everything, well, almost everything. I'm giving it 4 stars only because it doesn't have wheelchair accessible toilets or showers. There is a newish shower and toilet block but unfortunately it doesn't have wheelchair access. It's a pity just one toilet and one shower cubicle wasn't made slightly larger to fit a chair. Maybe sometime in the future management could address that issue? But, apart from that, this place is a delight.
showerReviews.author: Rob Manning

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’m currently staying at Geraldton Belair Gardens Caravan Park and I’ve been really impressed. From the moment I arrived, the check‑in was smooth and the staff were warm, friendly, and genuinely welcoming. My en‑suite site is spotless, with a shower that has consistently hot water, an absolute blessing on a cold night. The toilets and bathrooms are also kept beautifully clean and well maintained, which makes a big difference when you’re travelling.

The park itself has everything you could want for a comfortable stay. There’s a well‑equipped camp kitchen, clean BBQs, laundry facilities, and plenty of space to move around without feeling crowded. The layout feels open yet still private enough to relax. It’s also great having the beach just a short stroll away and town only a few minutes’ drive, so you get the best of both worlds, convenience and peace.

What really stands out here is the customer service. The staff go out of their way to make sure guests are happy and have what they need. Nothing feels like too much trouble. It’s the kind of place where you feel looked after, not just another booking on the system.

Surrounded by fresh coastal air, close to the ocean, and with everything kept in top condition, this is the perfect stop for anyone travelling through Geraldton or looking to stay a few days. I highly recommend Belair Gardens Caravan Park and would gladly return on my next trip.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This campsite is really bad!! We’ve stayed in caravan parks like this before, but the price was much cheaper — around $30 a night with a powered site — and here it’s $50.

The bathrooms are separate from the showers, and some of the bathroom locks don’t even work. The hot water doesn’t work, and the kitchen is terrible — it only has hotplates for cooking.

The only good thing is that the receptionist was friendly, but everything else is bad.
The place has no charm, and you don’t feel like staying another night. It’s poorly maintained and way too expensive for what it is.

showerReviews.reviewText: We were apprehensive about our stay based on some reviews. However we liked our stay despite some horrendous weather. The campsite was sheltered from the 50k wind and our ensuite was very convenient. Check in staff were very helpful and extremely efficient. You can walk into the city centre in about 40 minutes. The free museum was a great place to visit. There are many cafes to enjoy a meal as well. The camp kitchen is basic but has BBQ plates microwave fridge and wash up area. There was a bit of noise from the port overnight but overall it’s a quiet park. I would like to come back with better weather.

The park maintained a hold on my $200 security deposit for over a week after we stayed with them, which meant I couldn't access this money for most of my holiday.

I can see why they wanted a security deposit based upon how past guests had clearly treated the property. We paid $125 for a chalet cabin with a hole in a wall, cracked kitchen tiles that moved when you walked on them, and a plastic shower unit that felt like it was going to sink through the floor when you stood in it.

One star because the park was quiet, in a good location and the bed was comfortable.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our site was large enough for our car van and awning just. The amenities are a little old but kept very clean. The park has direct access to the beach 🏖️ and they also have a Sunset viewing deck which was packed the night we went so we went onto the beach. The beach is nothing special and has a sharp angle to come and with when walking. The off leash beach section is very close to the park which is great. The IGA is within walking distance and has most everything you need.
Last note, could you please clean the bathrooms after 10am to allow leaving guests use the facilities before setting off.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Annie and Mike at Sunset Beach Holiday Park are fabulous.
The cabin we stayed in number 20 was amazing. Views of the ocean. The ability to be able to entertain on the balcony from the kitchen with window opening on to a bar style bench. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything needed to cook and entertain. The shower was quite large and a confy double bed. There is also a second room for kids with double bunks.
Well our vehicle battery and alternator died morning we were to check out which ment we were going nowhere fast, except to the mechanic.
Annie and Mike were gracious enough to let us stay in the same cabin another night and offered their vehicle to us if we needed to pop to the shop for groceries.
We can not praise Sunset Beach Holiday Park enough and would like to say Thank you for your graciousness and hospitality.
Nigel and Sue Levey
showerReviews.author: Sue levey

showerReviews.author: Sue levey

showerReviews.reviewText:
$249 a Night — and This Is the Welcome I Get

I’ve just arrived at Sunset Beach Holiday Park today after hours on the road. My arthritis is flaring badly — both knees aching, every step slow and heavy. I limp my way from the car to reception. Anyone watching could see the effort it’s taking.

I walk in and say, “Hi, I’ve got a booking.” I explain it might be under my name or my daughter’s. No hello back, no welcome! She checks, says it’s under my name, and immediately asks for my car registration. I tell her it should already be on file because you can’t book with booking.com without entering it. She just says she doesn’t have it. No offer to check. No attempt to make it easier for me. So I hobble back out to my car, get the number, and come back in.

When I give it to her, she asks for my bank card and driver’s licence. This stops me. I’ve stayed in plenty of places and never been asked for a driver’s licence just to check in. I ask why. She says, “It’s our policy.” That’s it. So, still sore, I go back to my car a second time to get my wallet.

By the time I return, she’s walked away from the desk. I stand there waiting, my legs throbbing. When she comes back, I hand over my details and tell her, “By the way, I do Google Reviews, I’ve had nearly 16 million views on my account. Just letting her know.” I say it so she understands: customer service matters.

Travellers in caravans, RVs, and vans often drive for hours before they stop. They want a warm welcome, a smile, and to feel glad they’ve arrived. That first interaction sets the tone for the whole stay. Today, mine was cold, unhelpful, and made harder than it needed to be. If I was her manager, I would deal with her manner directly and explain that customers can make or break a place like this. You have to greet guests warmly and treat them well, especially after they’ve been on the road for hours.

And it’s a shame, because the place itself is lovely. My cabin is clean and stocked with the usual shampoo and body wash in the bathroom. There’s a microwave, air fryer, jug, toaster, and fridge,  everything you need except the food. The camp facilities are also good, with clean, well-kept kitchens, an easy-access dump point for caravans, and neat ablution blocks. The park is just steps from a beautiful beach, with picnic tables and grassed areas to enjoy the ocean view. It’s got everything you need to have a great stay, if the welcome matched the setting.

The unit walls are paper thin and you can hear your neighbours doing their business clearly. Not the type of things you need or want to hear

But the first impression is already soured. I arrived sore and tired, hoping for a welcome. Instead, I was met with policies and indifference. Facilities can be wonderful, but if the greeting falls flat, the whole experience is tainted from the start.
showerReviews.author: Donna Dehar-Leef

showerReviews.reviewText: We rang Loreen as we were about 35 minutes away and it was right on 4.30. She confirmed we were registered as staying there previously and as we had a gift voucher she said she would wait for us to book us in. We arrived a couple of minutes after 5 and true to her word she was in the office ready to book us in. We feel she went out of her way to assist us after driving down from Shark Bay. The toilets and showers might be a bit old but they were immaculately clean and well maintained. Loreen was able to book us into a drive through site so I didn't have to unhook from car. Grounds were very well kept and sunset viewing deck was very popular. We done guys. See you on our next trip north. Lyn and Kev (Site 1)
showerReviews.author: kevin mayger

showerReviews.reviewText: Tuesday night 30th September 2025 There are 8 parks For a Self Contained Area there are 6 caravans taking up the space who are not self contained (they do not have a grey watertank) when the ranger comes & checks he should be policing the caravans that are illegal & not fine the motorhomes who had to park in the boat bays. We have had this problem the whole time travelling in W.A. The rangers need to police the self contained area properly. We used to own a caravan & we put our own pipe underneath to make a grey water tank with a tap but over the east side of Australia that doesn’t work for them we were still not a motorhome which is fully self contained with toilet & shower & grey water tank.

showerReviews.reviewText: We were meant to stay 3 nights but only stayed one. The site was nice and roomy and the amenities whilst tired were clean but we felt uneasy around the place. Lots of permanents in the park and we felt watched and wouldn’t you know the cops turned up and spent a lot of time going through the van next to us. They even knocked on our door wanting to know if we had seen the people that lived there that day.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed there this past week with friends price was a bit expensive I think caravan 55 camp trailer 50 (power and water sites) and I has a swag didn't use power and paid 45 a night. It got real windy and wet and I asked if I could be in a cabin if available they were nice enough to if one for me for 2 nights, cabin was good although the gutter was loose and kept squeeking from the wind so hard to sleep and light in lounge room didn't work and light bulbs in bedroom lamp was blown.
Roads in the park need to be resurfaced...not all the lights in the caravan park were working made it a bit dangerous walking to the toilet block late at night.
Bbq area didn't have working lights as people were using their phone light to cook food.
We were at the top of the park opposite toilet and showers and they were close I guess coz it wasn't peak season was a bit of an inconvenience. Don't think I would stay there again for a while
showerReviews.author: Kelly Clear

showerReviews.reviewText:
Car park at Bob Davies park near Point Moore lighthouse with 6 spaces for overnight parking. Must be self-contained. No caravans or ground tents allowed,

Time and Cost: 24 hours, Free.

Access:  Sealed road to sealed car park.

Facilities: Small, partly shaded sealed camping area with room for 6 vehicles. Toilets, shower, bins, BBQ and seats available. Excellent Optus, Telstra and TV reception.

Ambiance: Beachside location, minimal road noise, can be windy.

Suited as an overnight stopover for self-contained vehicles. Short drive (2km) into Geraldton for shopping, fuel, water and dump point.
showerReviews.author: Robert Somerville

locations.title: Geraldton's Ocean West Holiday Units

showerReviews.reviewText: Hot water lasts 5 minutes, and takes 30+ min to return. We couldn’t shower everyone so had to shower kids at a relative’s home. I feel this should have been disclosed somewhere. Rusted showers, stained cupboards and carpets, dodgy back sliding doors that could easily be opened if someone tried. There were layers of dust on the pipes behind the stove - very visible and very accessible to be able to clean as it is a stand alone stove that can be moved. Oven was nasty. Walls and light switches had built up grime and food splashes. We were accused AND charged for taking a single pillow without being informed until I requested an explanation as they took $80 from my account (mind you, there’s a $100 cleaning deposit). Luckily we thought ahead and took before and after photos! After several days of emailing we were refunded and offered a discount for our next stay. Would not recommend due to uncleanliness, being charged without prior notice, not being provided an explanation until I kept requesting one. There was also no notice of when the remaining cost of the booking would be debited, just an estimate of “about a week before your stay” so you are expected to hold such a large amount in your card if you’ve booked online. For $500 p/night this hotel is way below standard. We were so disappointed.
showerReviews.author: The Trifecta

locations.title: Mantra Geraldton

showerReviews.reviewText:
I only stayed at Mantra for one night, but the room had a lot of handy features. There was a balcony, clean floors, and the basics were covered with a fridge, kettle, toaster, and even a dishwasher. The TV also had Netflix, which was a nice extra touch.

However, a few things let the stay down. I didn’t like the fluorescent lighting in the room, only one of the lamps worked, and the TV was extremely loud even on the lowest volume.

Overall, it was comfortable enough for a short stay, but a few small improvements would make the experience much better.
showerReviews.author: Allegra Pickering

showerReviews.reviewText: We were in the family apartments in the older section. The facilities are very tired and not much care seems to be made in keeping up appearances. We found one dead cockroach in the kitchen and one live one in the bathroom. Some of the kitchenware hadn't been cleaned since the previous guest, the dishwasher didn't work, the TV wouldn't connect to the WiFi, the outdoor spa and pool were not heated. When we spoke with reception we were told that's just how it is, the TVs were too old to connect and the heater just doesn't work. The balcony is facing a building site and was covered in dirt. At least the bedding and towels were clean and the gate remote control worked very well.

locations.title: The African Reef

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights.. The room , while big , had no table. No face washers, hand towel or soap for the  bathroom vanity .  It was the middle of winter and had no spare blankets which necessitated the A/c needing to be left on all night.   There were no extra pillows . The room was not serviced during our stay. It would have been good if the towels were replaced daily.. We had to ask staff for milk and tea bags, which had been forgotten when preparing our room.  The only iron was in the laundry room in a separate block .  The attached restaurant/bar was under renovation during our stay , it would have been helpful if this was disclosed at the time of booking.  No covered parking .  Quiet.    Great views   For over $200 per night it should have been better.
showerReviews.author: Tracy Reeves

locations.title: Coronation Beach Campground

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a pretty nice campsite with pit toilets and fun showers where you have to bring your own water. The children's playground is great. However, we decided to stay a few hundred meters away from the others near Oakabella Creek behind the dunes — for free. Track is a bit narrow and sandy but with a camper trailer and reduced tyres no dramas.
showerReviews.author: Peter - TheNomad.family

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a pretty nice campsite with pit toilets and fun showers where you have to bring your own water. The children's playground is great. However, we decided to stay a few hundred meters away from the others near Oakabella Creek behind the dunes — for free. showerReviews.author: Peter - TheNomad.family

showerReviews.reviewText: Coronation Beach Campground offers beautiful beachside camping at a very reasonable $20 per vehicle per night. The pay station is contactless card payment only but is very easy to use, bear in mind that all pitches are on a first come first served basis and can only be bought on a daily basis. The campground has basic facilities; long drop toilets and BYO water showers. There is no water on site so you must bring your own. A dump spot is available and located in the car park. The lack of facilities is more than made up for by the sunsets; there are two lookout points with elevated platforms to give you great views anytime of the day.
showerReviews.author: Will Burchell

showerReviews.reviewText: We have always come here for lunch, but never stayed. On the Web site it said $6 a person,  it has gone up to $15 a person. There is no power or water and not alot of parks, I think about 20. There  are 3 toilet blocks with 1 shower room( you have to bring your own shower and water)and 1 toilet. There are 2 BBQ and afew shelters.A playground for the children, a food van which is open Sat - Sunday  and a business where you can hire wind surfing gear. showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice clean toilets open 24/7. In the women's section there were 2x toilet stalls and 2x shower stalls, as well as a wheelchair accessible bathroom in a separate section.

This is a nice and quiet spot for vans and cars with rooftop tents etc to camp overnight. Self-contained RVs are not supposed to park here as they apparently have plenty of other options elsewhere if they don't need toilets.

As of Sept 2024, this spot and the "440 Roadhouse" are the only places in Geraldton with toilets open at night time! We tried the Lighthouse, Rubik's Cube, foreshore toilets, and even the 24/7 McDs (only the drive-thru is 24/7) as well as some of the other petrol stations and none were open.

locations.title: S Bend Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText: I had been past the S- Bend Caravan park a multitude of times ,(mostly driving trucks)  Now retired and getting to see everything I used to pass when on a Deadline. We booked in here for 3 nights and we're planning to stay longer. This place is like a "Hidden Gem". Everything about this park is clean and tidy. It is older but so well looked after. It is also very quiet. The staff are very friendly and nothing is a trouble to them. They have fuel and also have take away food at the shop There are beautiful green grass sites ,power and water available at prices that are very reasonable by today's standards. You can exit the rear of the park to drive to the beach especially if you're a keen on fishing.  There are no Jumping pillows, no swimming pool and not much for children to do but to my mind this place is perfect 👌.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Margaret River Motel is a solid choice for travelers prioritizing location and convenience. Its standout feature is the excellent position, just a short and easy walk from the main town center, which allows guests to explore cafes, shops, and restaurants without needing their car.
Rooms are generally praised for being clean, spacious, and comfortable, with some visitors specifically highlighting the cozy beds. While the decor may be a bit dated for some tastes, the motel offers all the essential amenities, including a pool and a BBQ area. The staff are frequently described as friendly, helpful, and professional, adding to the welcoming atmosphere. It's a great value-for-money option and a perfect base for exploring the region's famous wineries and natural attractions.

locations.title: Geraldton Visitor Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
I honestly didn’t expect Geraldton to be this busy — in the best way possible. I was imagining a quiet coastal stop a few hours north of Perth, but what I found was a vibrant city buzzing with life, charm, and so much more than I anticipated.

Tucked along the turquoise edge of the Indian Ocean, Geraldton has that easygoing seaside feel, but with all the amenities and energy of a larger town. It caught me off guard how well it balances natural beauty, history, and modern comforts. I came here for a break, and found myself swept up in everything the city has to offer.

The beaches are stunning — perfect for a swim, windsurfing, or just relaxing with a coffee from one of the surprisingly good local cafés (seriously, the café scene here is thriving). One of the most moving stops for me was the HMAS Sydney II Memorial. It’s not just a beautiful monument, but a deep reminder of the history this region holds.

And then there’s everything nearby: wildflower trails, the unreal Pink Lake which are just incredible. I kept discovering more and more to do — way more than I’d planned for.

What struck me most, though, was the community vibe. Friendly locals, art popping up in unexpected places, good food, and a sense that this is a place people truly love. Geraldton feels like a hidden gem that’s somehow still under the radar, but buzzing with life and intention. It’s the kind of place that surprises you — and then stays with you.
showerReviews.author: Chadni Islam

locations.title: Chapman Valley Rest Area

showerReviews.reviewText: A great spot to overnight and perfect for anything from a swag to a caravan. Mostly flat and looking out across the fields, it's nicer than some dedicated camp grounds that you would pay $20+ per night for! In this case there is an honesty box for payment to help cover the upkeep by the shire. For this you have access to one long drop toilet (clean and tidy) as well as a dedicated shower room, but it should be noted that this requires you to bring your own portable shower (or a bucket of water). Speaking of which, there is no water and so you must be self sufficient in that regard. There are also some undercover gas BBQ's as well as some picnic tables (also under cover). The rules state you can stay a maximum of one night before moving on. It's a cracking little spot and a perfect place for an overnight stay. If you are looking for food and drink, as well as free camping, you should also check out Nabawa Valley Tavern which is just 20 minutes East of this location (see my other reviews).
showerReviews.author: Mike Hamilton

locations.address: 381 Scarborough Beach Rd, Osborne Park WA 6017

showerReviews.reviewText:
0 STAR RATING
State Swim Osborne Park
Extremely Unprofessional and Disrespectful BEHAVIOUR by Staff Member ALISTAIR!!!!!

As a Parent with young children I witnessed a deeply upsetting incident yesterday at your Osborne Park complex involving a male staff member. I believe his name is ALISTAIR as listed on the supervisor board. He spoke to a female colleague in an absolute appalling, aggressive, condescending tone in front of young children and their families. It was completely unprofessional and unacceptable especially considering she did nothing to deserve this treatment.

The female staff member handled herself with remarkable professionalism and stayed very calm especially given the way she was being yelled at. I’ve seen her teach many times and genuinely believe she is one of your best swimming instructors.

To make matters worse I had been watching this staff member  ALISTAIR standing around just chatting. Clearly not supervising the children. A huge safety concern!!!!

ALISTAIR has NO accountability or integrity. I wanted to report him but I was so angry and upset by what I had just witnessed. He was completely at fault without a doubt.

As a paying customer it was extremely disappointing to see such disgusting behaviour being displayed. If this staff member continues to represent State Swim I will take it as a sign that this kind of behaviour is acceptable and I will be taking my children elsewhere.

I  hope you address this matter urgently. THIS SHOULD NOT BE TOLERATED especially where your staff are working closely with our children.

This staff member needs to go or clearly your reputation will!!!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
0 STAR RATING
State Swim Osborne Park
Extremely Unprofessional and Disrespectful BEHAVIOUR by Staff Member ALISTAIR!!!!!

As a Parent with young children I witnessed a deeply upsetting incident yesterday at your Osborne Park complex involving a male staff member. I believe his name is ALISTAIR as listed on the supervisor board. He spoke to a female colleague in an absolute appalling, aggressive, condescending tone in front of young children and their families. It was completely unprofessional and unacceptable especially considering she did nothing to deserve this treatment.

The female staff member handled herself with remarkable professionalism and stayed very calm especially given the way she was being yelled at. I’ve seen her teach many times and genuinely believe she is one of your best swimming instructors.

To make matters worse I had been watching this staff member  ALISTAIR standing around just chatting. Clearly not supervising the children. A huge safety concern!!!!

ALISTAIR has NO accountability or integrity. I wanted to report him but I was so angry and upset by what I had just witnessed. He was completely at fault without a doubt.

As a paying customer it was extremely disappointing to see such disgusting behaviour being displayed. If this staff member continues to represent State Swim I will take it as a sign that this kind of behaviour is acceptable and I will be taking my children elsewhere.

I  hope you address this matter urgently. THIS SHOULD NOT BE TOLERATED especially where your staff are working closely with our children.

This staff member needs to go or clearly your reputation will!!!!

DISGUSTING BEHAVIOUR ALISTAIR!!!!
showerReviews.author: Kath

Family own pool, it’s amazing. I start with my daughter at 2 years of age and progressed in a one teacher to 2 kids class, when she turned 3. All the teachers are great, very good with kids and super fun and patient. The office staff is amazing too, very helpful, super kind and lovely.
Even now that the pool is closed due to the pandemic, they’ve been sending regular email updates with info on their re-opening time and what are they doing in the mean time, upgrading the pool etc.
I can’t wait for my daughter to start swimming lessons again, and for my baby son to start soon too. Highly recommended!

locations.title: Snap Fitness 24/7 Mt. Lawley

showerReviews.reviewText:
THE BEST gym in Perth! This gym in Mount Lawley is bloody huge and has plenty of space and equipment to work out comfortably anytime of day. Don't be fooled thinking this is a cheap loveless chain gym as this is not the case.

It's super clean! They regularly clean and do a deep clean every Monday. If you're new to gyms don't take this for granted as some in the area are terrible. Showers are great too and plenty of change rooms if ya need them.

Have been a member for nearly 2 years and the culture of the gym is great. No crazy people or turbo bros around. Seen a few of the local bartenders and other local business staff using the place which is a good sign of the vibe.The customer fridge in the kitchen is a welcome bonus and It's great having access to a balcony if I need to take a call. I also like how I can use Snap gyms in Melbourne (And everywhere) at no extra cost when away for work.

All the dumbbells are in great condition with about 6 benches and I've only ever seen one machine break which was fixed within days.

Seriously super happy with this place and their great friendly staff that are always fast on their feet to help or fix an issue. Lastly watch out for the free burgers and tacos they hand out from time to time.. they'll ruin ya sets for the day ;)

A++

(Haven't done a class before but they seem popular with it's own private room away from the weights)
showerReviews.author: Paul M

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs Innaloo

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a member of Goodlife for quite some time and really enjoy the Innaloo branch. In my opinion, it is a very complete gym that offers everything you need for a good workout, even though there is always room for improvement.
The lower level has spacious changing rooms, a sauna, and a large area with plenty of cardio equipment. Upstairs, you will find machines for both upper and lower body training, a spin room, a large studio for group classes, and another smaller room next to it that I believe is used for Pilates sessions.
The gym is generally not too crowded during the day, although it gets busy during peak hours such as early mornings and late afternoons. Many machines are available in pairs, which helps a lot when one is already in use.
The atmosphere is well balanced, with people who are genuinely motivated to train, creating a positive and energetic environment.
showerReviews.author: Arthur Felipe Andrade

showerReviews.reviewText:
BUYERS BEWARE! Deciding between a few gyms to join as I am on the hunt for a new 24/7 gym as my local gym does not fit with my new schedule. Went in for a free 5 day trial as advertised on the website only to be told by a staff when I got there that it is only for friends of members and you can have the 5 day pass ONLY IF you are going to join. What is the point of trial then? The staff then proceeded to tell me about this deal they have going on now and wanted me to sign up immediately on my first visit without even a workout there. After asking a few more times and explaining that I would like to try first, he reluctantly gave me the 5 day pass. Started my pass on Monday, and on Wednesday once again he was asking me to join. On Thursday he gave me a call saying that I have to book an appointment to discuss membership options with him on Friday otherwise they have to charge me if I come in for a workout on Friday (despite it was still on a "5 day trial") as "you have no intention to join". The overly pushy and presumptuous attitude was definitely off-putting as they seem to want you to just buy hastily without consideration and I will not be joining Goodlife.

On the positive side, the lockers room is clean and spacious, there is a sauna too. The facilities are also new and with good varieties of equipments. However, it is quite crowded even during off-peak times like 2-3pm. Facilities wise I have no complaints, however the rude salesperson indicates that this place might not have the best training environment as staff is just as important as facilities when it comes to choosing a gym. I was told that I could not use the lockers as it's for members only by the staff however on my second visit the front receptionist who was nice and friendly gave me a temporary locker card to use without asking and just asked for a key or ID which was fair.

Based on my negative experience, for anyone who is thinking of joining beware of their AGGRESSIVE SALES TACTICS! Before you sign up please look carefully at the fine print of the contract as this gym seems so sus! With my current gym they only asked me once after my trial ended. This is by far the most pushy gym I've been to so far. I understand gym salesperson would obviously try to sell their gym to the best they can as that's how they make a living from but expecting someone to make a huge financial commitment without trying, persistently asking even before the trial finishes, terminating your trial early because THEY JUDGE YOU as uninterested is LUDICROUS.
showerReviews.author: Joy Er

I have been a member of this club since 2009 and have seen many managers and staff come and go over the years. They always do their best to keep up the standards of the club and the more recent newly appointed club manager and her team have really made some very noticeable changes/improvements 👍🏼
Although the equipment and facilities have stayed pretty much the same it is always in good working order. The change rooms can do with a little upgrade/update. All in all a great club with really good staff and members! Thank you for making my fitness routine/journey so enjoyable 😊

showerReviews.reviewText: Two star, it get the third because of its proximity to the beach. The room is dated (70s) with a small AC that works hard to keep the temp down. No AC in either of the bedrooms. Small fan supplied to coax the cool air to the bedrooms. The single bedroom is actually the entry hall. It has the basics and is priced that way. The facilities are good. Great pool, loads of shade, nice BBQs. Parking is private but tight and not secure. No Internet, older TV only terrestrial channels. Great water pressure. The hot water is a bit fiddly and super hot! All in all sleeping is ok but basic accommodation only.

locations.title: Burns Beach Sunset Village
locations.address: Burns Beach Cvan Pk, 35 Ocean Parade, Iluka WA 6028

showerReviews.reviewText:
Burns Beach Sunset Village is truly a hidden gem! Nestled along the stunning coastline, this campsite offers breathtaking scenery that will leave you in awe. The sunsets here are nothing short of magical, painting the sky with vibrant hues that make for unforgettable evenings.

The campsite itself is wonderfully maintained and provides all the amenities you could ask for. From clean facilities to spacious pitches, everything is designed to ensure a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The tranquil atmosphere and the sound of the waves make it the perfect place to unwind and reconnect with nature.

We highly recommend Burns Beach Sunset Village for anyone seeking a serene and picturesque camping experience. We can't wait to return and create more wonderful memories!

it was quite budget and outdated, thin pillows, not great water pressure and drainage, hot water cut out a bit, and lots of things were starting to rust or salt damage (but mostly due to the proximity to the beach). but the overall stay was pleasant, and it did the job.

locations.title: Sandcastles Scarborough

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed in Rm 309 and if it wasn’t for the views from the balcony we would’ve gone elsewhere. The room is very dated and dirty. Tile flooring was cracked and chipped throughout. Grout missing from corners. Ensuite shower didn’t work. Aircon needed repairing and hadn’t been cleaned for years as filter was thick with dust. Some very average painting has been done trying to cover things up. Entry door looks like someone has tried breaking in. Over all was terrible.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location, location, location.

Amazing building in a great spot on the Scarborough beach front. Transport links to the city and locally could do with a rethink, it seems to take an un-reasonable length of time to get into the city.

Local beach front upgrades are taking longer than planning had suggested however they are starting to come together and look fairly impressive.

Building facilities are sufficient with a small but clean private swimming pool and basic spa facilities.
showerReviews.author: Ian McDonald

locations.title: Rendezvous Hotel Perth Scarborough

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm a Scarborough local and thought I'd book a couple nights to experience Scarborough from a different perspective.

Negatives:
I paid extra for a ocean view which was good but I couldn't see the sunset from my balcony sadly. (Recommend sunset view)
The booking said "double bed" and I paid for a couples room but it was two single beds put together which was quite uncomfortable since you sink inbetween.
The ironing board was broken and didn't stand up as the leg welds were rusted and broken.
The shower hose was damaged and leaked.
The TV didn't let you use a HDMI which was annoying at night before bed.
Room service food is highly priced.
Only one escalator worked, from the Scarborough entrance and the main entrance was close due to renovations.
The pool was out of action due to renovations.

Positives:
The room service food (Wagyu burger) was tasty.
The provided body and hair soaps & moisturisers were nice.
The view was good seeing half the beach towards Hilary's and Scarborough's new developments.

All in all I would stay again but I would need to confirm an actual double bed, sunset view and top floor allocation.
showerReviews.author: J J

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked a room there about 2 weeks ago, when there neither escalators nor their elevators to reception were in service. Room service took over an hour to arrive, and was served what seemed like packaged food.

Our rooms were not cleaned throughout the day. We had no fresh towels because of this. Tried to call reception 6 times to grab some, and no answer. Waited an hour and still couldn't get through. We ended up going down there ourselves and still had to wait in a 20 minute line for towels.

We were called by reception twice, and told that we couldn't use their TV as it was "Too loud" - one of the times was at 5pm, the volume was set to 30, the second time was at 8pm and the volume was only 20...
I attempted to confront reception about this, as this is supposed to be a facility we can use, and I was approached by the rude reception manager who accused me of "breaching my contract" by using it. I asked her multiple times to show me where my contract had been breached, to which she couldn't do. The manager was never able to provide any proof or evidence to back her claim of us breaching contract. I had paid a lot of money to be able to use these facilities, and as I tried to explain that to her, instead of listening to me, she threatened to kick me out of the hotel, and walked away midst conversation.

Her behaviour and attitude was absolutely disgusting. As a manager, she should be trying to make every guest feel welcome, and I was treated the complete opposite. Not an ounce of kindness was shown from her, and it seems other guests were treated as a priority over us.

Waited 10 days after my visit and didn't receive my deposit back. I had to call the hotel myself, only to find they hadn't released the payment until my call.

Everything about this hotel is atrocious. I would not recommend to anyone.
showerReviews.author: Amber

Such a shame as if clean would be an outstanding place to stay.

showerReviews.reviewText: My son (who has a disability)and i booked Seashells Scarborough for our yearly getaway. We'd never been to Perth, so we felt Scarborough was a good middle point for sightseeing. We found Seashells. We booked 9 nights from Oct 24, 2024, to Nov 2nd, 2024. We were so happy. Great location, ideal for what we needed. Our unit was on the 4th floor and they have a lift. Our unit was older and is going to be renovated (it has newish furnishings now). Underground secure parking was a bonus. The heated pool was being renovated so,  out of service during our stay, but we made use of the other pool. The whole place was so quiet, it was lovely. We had a balcony right on the front so the sunsets were awesome. Minutes walk to Coles and eateries. Loved seeing the Indian Ocean each morning and evening. The kitchen had all we needed and the washer/dryer were handy. We even had a second toilet in our unit. But I want to shout out to the lovely lady on reception, Helen. She was delightful. Such a lovely lady who helped us out and always had a smile and was friendly. We enjoyed our trip so much, we'll definitely be back and will recommend to friends and family.
showerReviews.author: sandra duncan

locations.title: Indian Ocean Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked for a business trip without checking and ended up having an absolute blast. The decor, vibe, staff and atmosphere are all . If you're bothered by noise avoid the pool-front ground floor. This place goes OFF on a Thursday and Friday evening. Absolutely heaving but great people and great tunes. Wash off the hangover with a dip in the sundrenched pool and cook yourself tender in the jacuzzi. The 70s fitout is immaculate, no idea how the rooms can be in such good nick with this retro fitout. Doors are paper thin so be fairly warned if you can't sleep through a party raging next door. Shouldn't have been a good mix for my business trip but I learnt into and it was!
showerReviews.author: Abe Warwick

locations.title: Spiral Backpackers Hostel

showerReviews.reviewText:
Spiral is the best hostel I’ve ever stayed at!
It has such a warm, family vibe thanks to the amazing community — most people are long-termers, so it truly feels like one big family. A lot of people come here just to bridge a short period until they find a house, but end up staying because there’s simply nothing better than living with your friendgroup.
It’s definitely the people that make this place so special, but even the hostel itself is great value for money and cozy. The beds have curtains for privacy, the bathrooms are cute and mostly clean, and the kitchen is spacious and well-equipped. Plus, we have two TVs for relaxed movie evenings! We also got pink girl's bathroom and the best shower partys in there as well as 2 disco balls (one at the reception and one in the kitchen) which is bringing the party vibes and a pet reptile at the reception. The AC is keeping it cool even on hot days and
showerReviews.author: Ronja Ellmer

showerReviews.author: Ronja Ellmer

showerReviews.reviewText:
My first 2 days here I would have agreed it was the worst hostel ever. People's stuff was strewn everywhere to the point where you could hardly walk. But day 3, and a normal amount of luggage, the floors had been cleaned, bath scrubbed and it was like any normal hostel. Maybe the mess was because it had been a big holiday weekend.

The kitchen is huge, and clean, which was nice. But 1) they could use having a system to label food. Japan, on the door to storage, they had installed a pen, slips of paper asking name, room #, checkout date; with roll of tape. Impressive! 2) Spiral wanted you to wash and dry your dishes but they were constantly running out of drying towels.

I agree about the crinkly pillows. A nuisance every time you turn over.

The location cannot be beat. So near the bus and train stations, near a huge IGA supermarket, lots of restaurants and attractions within walking distance.

So I'd say what you see all depends on the day. I saw no bugs. A few flies came in when the doors were open.
showerReviews.author: Corinne Standish

locations.title: Solace Day Spa

showerReviews.reviewText: Solace Day Spa is a beautiful venue, calming, welcoming and thoughtfully designed. The staff are wonderful and genuinely caring, making you feel completely at ease from the moment you arrive. The facilities are outstanding. The sauna was excellent, the magnesium bath deeply relaxing and even the cold plunge was invigorating and well worth it. I also loved the dopamine shower, incredibly effective and uplifting. My massage therapist, Georgia was absolutely lovely, with a warm and caring nature and an excellent therapeutic touch that left me feeling both relaxed and renewed. Highly recommend this incredible wellness experience.
showerReviews.author: Tessa Kaminski

showerReviews.reviewText: We had the slice of solace for two. Not sure if it's worth the price. Loved the rain shower and the steam room..but there wasn't any body wash in the shower and we had to ask in the middle of the shower. The masseuse who took care of my husband was rushed. The refreshments were sad. Not worth the drive or the effort. With such luxury space, you guys could do better. Kindly take this as a constructive criticism.
showerReviews.author: Suzanne George

showerReviews.reviewText:
I dont think I have ever had a more pleasant trip to the sauna then what I have at Alix's in home infared.

Everything about the experience is five star from Alix's warm welcome into her home to walking into an immaculate private room where the sauna is located that has everything you need including oils' books and towels to name a few. She pre heats it to make sure its ready for use upon arrival and is incredibly accommodating and the sauna is of an excellent high standard that gets the perspiration happening nice and quick.

There really isn't any other place i would go to too use a sauna.

You'd be a fool to not even try

showerReviews.reviewText:
I surprised my partner with a 60-minute sauna and ice bath at Melt, and it was awesome!
Tamasin had everything ready for us - the sauna was pre-heated, the ice bath was icy, and Tamasin offered breathing support if we wanted. Tamasin is knowledgable about health and wellness and is so lovely to be around. The optional add-ons are great and made us feel really cared for. The fresh towels were a welcome touch and meant we could rinse and freshen up afterwards, ready to go on with our day.
The environment is quiet, clean, and private. It fits two people perfectly.
We love that Melt is local to us in Applecross and hope we can come back soon! I can highly recommend booking in. 😁

locations.title: The Well Cottesloe

showerReviews.reviewText:
The most delightful wellness space I am so grateful to have found. The Wellness Cottesloe feels like paradise the moment you open the front door.
You are firstly greeted by aromatherapy and tranquil plants which for me is pure bliss. The reformers are programme operated with so many programmes at various levels on offer.
Upstairs the infra red saunas and dry sauna plus cold showers are simply beautifully presented . Modern sophistication is the vibe l feel.
The atmosphere of tranquility is a credit to Lily who by the way always greets me with a lovely smile every day and whereby any request l have  is never too much trouble .
Thank you  🙏🌸🙏
I just simply love my new energy gaining space .

showerReviews.reviewText: The reviews are absolutely true – owner Lily has crafted an absolute sanctuary of wellness. The pilates studio/hybrid room is welcoming space that features top-of-the-line reformers with on-demand classes and cardio machines. The infrared saunas are perfect after a workout or long day – I play podcasts over the Bluetooth and just enjoy the benefits of the heat. The dry sauna and ice shower contrast therapy is a refreshing experience. Memberships are unbelievable value for the facilities, customer service and range of timeslots to suit your busy schedule.
showerReviews.author: Belinda Hermawan

showerReviews.reviewText: The Well Cottesloe is such a beautiful space for wellness and recovery. The Pilates studio is modern, calming, and perfect for moving at your own pace. I absolutely love the sauna and ice showers for contrast therapy – the combination of infrared, dry sauna, and the refreshing ice showers is incredible for both body and mind. The atmosphere is serene, stylish, and thoughtfully designed, making it the perfect spot to reset, recharge, and leave feeling amazing.
showerReviews.author: Ella McCaughan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I almost don’t want to share The Well because it’s that good… but here I am, oversharing. Again. 🙃 As a busy mom, finding something that actually slots into the chaos of life is rare, but The Well nails it.

The on-demand Pilates has been a game-changer. I do the gym-series (a.k.a. Pilates with dumbbells) and wow — it’s brutal in the best way. Add in quick core sessions or stretch classes, and you’ve got the perfect recipe for feeling strong. Oh, and the step master? Let’s just say my glutes are still filing complaints.

And the infrared sauna? Total love affair. I hook up Audible on Bluetooth, do some seated stretches, and while my body’s being slow-cooked to perfection, my brain is off living its best life in a world of personal growth. Multitasking at its finest.

The Finnish sauna is its own kind of magic — pure, deep heat followed by ice-cold showers. A different kind of cooked and frozen, and somehow exactly what you didn’t know you needed. You truly never regret coming over here.

The vibes? Warm, welcoming, and just the right mix of “wellness” and “real life.” Honestly, part of me wants to gatekeep forever… but fine, go ahead and join the cult of good vibes. Just don’t beat me to the sauna. 😏
showerReviews.author: Travelling Trio

showerReviews.reviewText: As someone who’s been doing saunas for years and considers himself a true sauna lover — The Well has completely raised the bar. This place is something else. The design, the atmosphere, the attention to detail — it’s a sanctuary. The infrared and dry sauna combined with ice shower experience here is unmatched. It’s clear that every element has been thoughtfully created to promote deep relaxation and wellness. I’ve honestly never seen anything quite like it. So glad to have this gem finally open. Highly recommend to anyone serious about quality sauna time. Imad Warda

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs Cottesloe

showerReviews.reviewText: My wife and I used this club for almost 3 months while staying in nearby Mosman Park.  We were happy to be able to get daily workouts in in their Les Mills classes (Body Pump, Body Attack, Body Balance) and yoga.  The gym is relatively crowded with lots of cardio, stationary and free weight and machines.  You'll find people all over on the floor doing their workouts or working with a personal trainer.  The locker rooms are large but can get very steamy in hot weather.  The front desk staff is very friendly.  The only improvement I would suggest is class scheduling.  Most of the classes I attended started late, largely because they are scheduled pretty close to one another, making it difficult for one group to "clear out" before the next class starts.  There may have been other factors as well, not sure.  If they spaced out the classes a bit more or ensured they started and ended on time this would remove a petty annoyance from an otherwise very enjoyable gym experience.  We'll be back in January and plan to sign up again!
showerReviews.author: Ron Mele (ScubaNut2014)

showerReviews.reviewText: I’m not a regular member at Nedlands Anytime Fitness, but I needed to use a shower before heading out and this was the closest anytime gym at the time. When I arrived, I noticed two cleaners actively scrubbing the showers, which was great to see. I only had to wait about five minutes before one was available, and I was honestly impressed by how spotless and well maintained it was. It didn’t feel like I was using a typical public gym shower at all everything was fresh, clean, and comfortable.

showerReviews.reviewText: Cottesloe Beach is another great spot that offers public showers, scenic views, and plenty of space for sunbathing. showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall was happy with stay.
Our room was two bedroom, two storey, 5 beds, kitchen, lounge and balcony. No ocean view and would not recommend for anyone who struggles with stairs. Fridge was on high so everything froze (including a carton of beer). No hair dryer or shampoo and conditioner. Quite dated but great value for money. 5 star on cleanliness! Actually struggled to find any sign of dirt or dust. Comfortable beds. Would definitely bring my family back!

Overall was happy with stay.
Our room was two bedroom, two storey, 5 beds, kitchen, lounge and balcony. No ocean view and would not recommend for anyone who struggles with stairs. Fridge was on high so everything froze (including a carton of beer). No hair dryer or shampoo and conditioner. Quite dated but great value for money. 5 star on cleanliness! Actually struggled to find any sign of dirt or dust. Comfortable beds. Would definitely bring my family back!
showerReviews.author: Danielle Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText: We paid extra to get a beachfront apartment, one of the highest priced rooms advertised in Cottesloe. Unfortunately we paid a 4-star price and got a 1-star room. Part of a 1980s complex around a pool but with most units having long-term tenants leaving junk around. One neighbour was clearly a champion burper, letting loose every now and then. The first impression after opening the door was from the musty smell. The rooms have not been renovated in their lifetime - a give-away is the lack of pictures available online. Even the kitchen draws contain 1980s utensils. The cupboards throughout the apartment were misaligned.The lounge suite needs a good clean. The TV image was terrible, suggesting the screen has been dropped or smashed somehow. The toilet trickle fed for more than 5 minutes to refill the cistern. After having a shower the floor mat had black mould on the underside. The spiral stairs to the loft bedroom are a death-trap. The car park was secure but the space very small. It does indeed have a beach view but most people would feel more at home if they put a tent up on the foreshore. We booked and paid for two nights but left after one preferring to lose our money than stay any longer.
showerReviews.author: Dave C

locations.title: Cottesloe Beach View Apartments

showerReviews.reviewText: We loved our apartment so much, we were so sad to leave. Our host Imogen was great at communicating with us and super responsive. The apartment was perfectly located, right on the beach at Cottesloe. It was very roomy and the view was unbelievable. Imogen made sure that everything we needed was there when we arrived, tea, coffee, milk, water, toiletries, washing machine and dishwasher tablets,  we didn’t need to worry about anything. We loved every minute.

showerReviews.reviewText:
A beautifully positioned two-bedroom apartment located on the corner of the block, offering uninterrupted frontal views of the sea. The residence features a fully equipped kitchen with an extensive array of utensils and appliances, seamlessly integrated into an open-plan living and dining area. This space flows effortlessly onto an L-shaped veranda via two glass patio doors, inviting natural light and coastal breezes.
The apartment includes a modern bathroom with a shower cubicle, complemented by in-unit laundry facilities including a washing machine and dryer for added convenience.
Ideally situated in the heart of Cottesloe, the property is within easy walking distance of vibrant cafés and restaurants. Excellent public transport links and Uber access make exploring Perth CBD and Fremantle both simple and efficient.
A fantastic finale to our Western Australia journey and our sincere thanks to Imogen and the cleaning team for their outstanding hospitality and attention to detail.
showerReviews.author: B Ritchie

showerReviews.reviewText:
When I first saw the pictures of Cottesloe Beach View Apartments, I told myself it was too good to be true. But when I arrived, the aesthetics, cleanliness and beauty of the place was exactly as it was in the photos. Although the property was built in the 1980s, it is very well maintained and I stepped into a clean and well furnished apartment. It was so delightful to arrive at the place with everything neatly laid out, and the bedside lamps and fans left on. Our host Imogen was excellent from start to finish and very helpful in providing an item that we forgot to bring along during our trip.

The instructions were clear and given at just the right times. At any time, Imogen was very responsive via email and I felt like there was ready help at any point if needed.

The most beautiful part of this property is its view of the amazing Cottesloe beach. There were even beach chairs, beach towels and an umbrella provided for our use.

Thank you so much for a wonderful stay. I cannot recommend this property more and wish I had booked a longer stay. Will be leaving a part of my heart at Cottesloe.
showerReviews.author: Sophia Huang

locations.title: Pier 21 Apartment Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText: We recently stayed at Pier 21 Apartments for a two night stay in Freo as a family of four. The apartments are located right on the water and are clean well laid out and modern, not tired at all like some apartments. The service was excellent and friendly. The amenities were clean and well serviced. I used the gym, spa and pool as well as the table tennis table. We had breakfast one morning in the cafe and the service, portion sizes and quality were excellent. Well done would stay again in a heartbeat.
showerReviews.author: Bridget Cairns

showerReviews.reviewText: We recently stayed at Pier 21 Apartments for a two night stay in Freo as a family of four. showerReviews.author: Bridget Cairns

showerReviews.reviewText:
Whilst looking (and still looking) for a new home/rental, my partner and I had an extended stay with the Pier21 crew and we have nothing but praise for them all.

Tenesia deserves a personal mention due to her outstanding customer service attitude. Nothing was too much for Tenesia and she went above and beyond to ensure our stay was easy and comfortable. We had to move rooms a couple of times and Tenesia organised Nigel (maintenance gentleman) to help move our belongings.
The new rooms were ready for us to easily move into without having to wait and a big thank you to Nigel who kindly moved everything for us.

The rooms are clean and comfortable with fast wifi, gym, undercover, gated, free parking,  pool and sun beds, visitor washing machines and dryers.
The views of the river on your doorstep, with boats, jet skis, birds, ducks, people walking and much more whilst sitting or laying back on your own private balcony.

Such a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere that we highly recommend especially as we’ve stayed at quite a few places in the last 6 months.

Pier21 is definitely our Number 1 favourite.

Our thanks to the 21.crew for their continued kindness and understanding during a challenging time. You’re simply the best!
showerReviews.author: Mindy Baylor

showerReviews.reviewText: Such a beautiful spot to stay. Ours was a quick getaway for 1 night and was perfect. The room was spacious, very tidy, a quiet location, it had great amenities in the room and the view was stunning, well worth paying $35 extra for the river view apartment. Breakfast in the lounge was delicious and the staff were super friendly. Only a couple of things I didn't like was the open top window in the bathroom which made it very cold, the fact you have to step into the bath for a shower and the dinner menu was not appealing at all. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back again.
showerReviews.author: Jo Zuvela
